Les femmes du groupe AMBATIESSIRI 1se disent porter toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable et fructueuse.
texts.en: The Ambatiessiri 1 Group consists of married women with an average age of 30 and three children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Dioni, one of the villages in the Boroueli prefecture, in Segou, the fourth largest administrative region in the republic of Mali.  The women of Ambatiessiri 1 Group work with Soro Yiriwaso to better carry out their farming business.  Their crops include, among others, millet, groundnuts, sesame, beans, etc.  They are on their seventh loan with the micro-finance institution.  With this loan, Ms. Maman, the person standing at the very right of the photo, plans to pay for labor costs and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and other small equipment for maintaining her 0.5 hectares of sesame. At the end of the season, the harvest is sold for cash in Konobougou.  She plans to earn an average profit of 80,000 FCFA per season which will be partly reinvested in her business.  The women of Ambatiessiri 1 Group are confident in their successful and sustainable agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weedkiller and small equipment.

loans.name: Ambatiessiri Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe AMBATIESSIRI II est constitué de10 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. La plupart d’entre eux vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Dioni un des villages de la préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou, (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe AMBATIESSIRI II collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (mil, arachide, sésame, haricot etc.) 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Madame BIBI, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheter de la semence, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 1 hectare de sésame.
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Konobougou.
Elle envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 90 000F CFA par campagne qui sera en parti investi dans le commerce.
Les femmes du groupe AMBATIESSIRI II se disent satisfaites de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable et fructueuse.
texts.en: The Ambatiessiri II Group consists of 10 married women with an average age of 32 and four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Dioni, one of the villages in the Boroueli prefecture, in Segou, the fourth largest administrative region in the republic of Mali. The women of Ambatiessiri II Group work with Soro Yiriwaso to better carry out their farming business. Their crops include, among others, millet, groundnuts, sesame, beans, etc. They are on their seventh loan with the micro-finance institution. With this loan, Ms. Bibi, the second person sitting from left to right of the photo, plans to pay for labor costs and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and other small equipment for maintaining her one hectare of sesame. At the end of the season, the harvest is sold for cash in Konobougou. She plans to earn an average profit of 90,000 FCFA per season which will be partly reinvested in her business. The women of Ambatiessiri II Group are happy to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are confident in their successful and sustainable agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weedkiller, and small equipment.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es una persona que se independizo  hace varios años de sus padres, vive solo en la ciudad de Luque, actualmente tiene como meta terminar su carrera universitaria de nutricionista y con  ello lograr  tener su propio consultorio de nutrición o trabajar en una entidad de la salud.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que son muchos los gastos que debe cubrir.
texts.en:
Emilio became independent from his parents a few years ago, and lives alone in the city of Luque.  Currently his goal is to finish his university career studying to become a nutritionist and by doing that achieve having his own nutrition office or work in a health facility.

He is asking for this loan so that he is able to cover the costs of his degree, since there is a lot of cost he has to cover.

loans.use: to pay for degree expenses

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, estudia y también trabaja a la vez, comenta que viene de una familia muy trabajadora y que su meta es poder recibirse y ser un profesional.
Esta estudiando la carrera de licenciatura agropecuaria, una carrera que le gusta mucho, y por la que se esfuerza. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Esteban is from the city of Caaguazú.  He goes to school and works at the same time.  He says that he comes from a very hard-working family, and his goal is to be able to graduate and become a professional.

He is studying to get a degree in agriculture, a career that he likes a lot.  That is why he puts forth great effort.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to make his university payments.  This way he will be able to continue going to school as he has been doing.

loans.use: to make his university payments.

loans.name: Dhimiter

texts.en:
This is Dhimiter, a 40-year-old married father of 16 and 13 year old children.

Dhimiter has been involved in fishing and apple farming for a very long time, and both enterprises are profitable.  Dhimiter wants to buy a new fishing net with this loan.

He lives in a village situated on the shores of Lake Ohrid.  The lake straddles the mountainous border between southwestern Macedonia and eastern Albania. It is one of Europe's deepest and oldest lakes.  Its aquatic ecosystem is of worldwide importance.  More than 200 species call it home. 

Almost everyone involved in the fishing business seek trout and ‘cironka,’ comparable to small sardines.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain se dedica mucho a sus estudios, es una persona que quiere poder sobresalir con su esfuerzo y sacrificio, es por ello que esta poniendo todo de si. Comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva lo uso para poder pagar sus clases de la universidad, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, y seguir a la vez luchando por sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Efrain puts a lot into his studies - he is a person who wants to excel through his own efforts and sacrifice, and this is why he is giving his all. He comments that he used his previous Kiva loan to pay for his classes at the university, which was a great help to him.
Today he is requesting a new loan to be able to pay his course fees and be able to continue with his studies and, at the same time, to keep perusing his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia es una chica sacrificada que está trabajando para poder estudiar, así para poder ayudar a su familia.
Comenta que su meta es ser alguien importante y recibirse de Licenciada en administración de empresa. Aspira seguir estudiando para ser útil a su comunidad y a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma seguir con su meta, que es la de ser una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a young woman who makes sacrifices who is working so that she can study and so that she can help her family.
She comments that it is her goal to be someone important and to receive her degree in Business. She plans to keep studying to be useful to her community and her family.
She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her course fees and, in this way, to pursue her goal which is to be a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay course fees.

loans.name: Ilse

texts.es:
Ilse es de la ciudad de Concepción, quiere ser una doctora, sus padres no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar, y ella ahora si la tiene y la está aprovechando y hoy ya está en el segundo año de la carrera y quiere terminar. 
Ilse quiere poder ayudar a sus padres por medio de sus estudios y también a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud.
Pide este préstamo para cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, ya que la carrera que eligió es un poco costosa y quiere poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Ilse is from the city of Concepción and she wants to be a doctor. Her parents didn't have the opportunity to study, and she now has that opportunity and is taking advantage of it. She is now in the second year of her degree course and wants to complete it. 
Ilse wants to be able to help her parents through her studies and also the help people who need health care.
She is requesting this loan to cover her university fees, as the degree that she has chosen is a bit expensive and she wants to be able to cover her costs.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan trabaja en un club social, esta preparando su tesis de ingeniería industrial y al culminar podrá seguir sus objetivos que están relacionados con su carrera en el sector industrial.
Juan es una persona que se esta esforzando por ser alguien en la vida, poder sobresalir por medio de sus estudios, y así ganarse la vida de una manera digna.
pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan works at a social club. He is preparing his thesis in industrial engineering, and upon finishing, he will continue to pursue objectives related to his career in the industrial sector.

Juan is a person who is striving to be someone in life, to be able to excel through his studies, and to earn a living in a worthy way.

He is asking for this loan to be able to invest in paying his university fees, and therefore continue his studies.

loans.use: pagar cuotas de universidad.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for education expenses such as materials and photocopying.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria actualmente se encuentra en el 2do. semestre de la carrera de Enfermería, también esta trabajando en una casa de familia, a la par que estudia.
Tiene varias expectativas, le gustaría trabajar en un hospital en donde el pueda desarrollar lo que estudia, y también crecer como persona.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su facultad, ya que asi podrá cubrir un tiempo ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Maria is currently in her second semester of Nursing courses.  She is also working in a family home during her studies.  She has various hopes: she would like to work in a hospital where she could practice what she is studying, and would also like to grow as a person.

She is asking for this loan so that she will be able to pay her university's fees, since in this way she will be able to cover for a time this cost she has.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more candy, cookies, Churritos snacks, plantain chips, and more.

loans.name: Francisca Guadalupe

texts.es:
Francisca de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado de educación básica, esta casada; su pareja trabaja como empleado en promoción social, tiene dos hijas que viven en casa y estan estudiando, nadie mas vive con ella. 

Francisca tiene el negocio de ganado de repasto, lo ha desempeñado por mas de 8 años, lo aprendio de su padre y luego con el apoyo de su esposo decidio hacerlo para obtener un ingreso economico mejor, ademas posee una tienda.  El ganado lo mantiene como a 1 km de su casa y viaja a pie y la tienda la tiene en casa. En estas actividades se involucra su hijo mayor y su esposo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de rapasto, le mejorara mucho porque tendra mas ganado para repastar y asi poder tener mejores ingresos. La necesidad satisfecha es que pueda comprar de una vez y por lo tanto obtendra una satisfaccion con el préstamo.

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando de la mejor manera, para obtener mejores recursos para ampliar los negocios y en cuanto a sus hijos que estudien y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
34 year old Francisca studied through the 9th grade. She is married and her husband works as an employee in community development. They have 2 daughters who live at home and are in school. Nobody else lives with her.
Francisca has a business raising grazing cattle. She has done this for more than 8 years and she learned the work from her father and later with the help of her husband decided to do it in order to have greater income as well as having a store. She keeps the cattle 1km from her house travels there on foot and she has the store in her house. Her eldest daughter and husband are involved in the work. 
She is requesting a loan to buy grazing cattle. This will help her because she will have more cattle to graze and so she will be able to have more income. A one-time purchase will yeild results from the loan.  
Her dreams are to be able to keep working in the best way so that she can have better resources to grow the businesses so that her children can study and be academically prepared.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle. This would help her a lot because she would have more cattle to graze and so would have more income.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Sololá es una ciudad amplia geográficamente hablando, la población, el comercio, es un crecimiento día a día y por lo tanto de mucho movimiento.

También crece la demanda de transporte para llevar a la población a sus respectivos destinos.  En esto se ocupa don Margarito de 44 años, quien es chofer de un bus extraurbano ocupándose de esta actividad desde hace algunos años.

Le gusta servir a la gente y sabe que es una manera de hacerlo, transportándola a su lugar de actividades.  Durante sus años en este servicio colectivo Margarito ha tenido contacto con la gente y esto a él le gusta.

Su trabajo es su única fuente de ingreso para su familia compuesta de cinco hijos.  Su deseo es remodelar su casa para vivir con su familia más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Sololá is a quite a large city in geographical and commercial terms; it also has a large population and so is very bustling and growing every day.

Demand for transport services is also growing, as people need to arrive at their respective destinations. And so it is in transport that 44-year-old Margarito works. He has been an intercity bus driver for a number of years.

Margarito likes to serve people and knows that transportation is one way of doing this. Over the years Margarito has been in contact with a lot of people, and he likes this.

Margarito's driving work is the only source of income for his family, where he has five children. Margarito wants to remodel his house in order to live more comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to remodel his house.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
En la actualidad vivimos en mundo que se va moviendo día a día de acuerdo a la tecnología y no todos somos la excepción ya que desde el más pequeño hasta más grande en la familia poseemos artículos tecnológicos y fue ahí como Xiomara hace 4 años vio la necesidad que poseían muchas de las personas que habitan en su comunidad y con unos pequeños ahorros que tenía decidió iniciar su propio negocio de ventas de artículos tecnológicos como teléfonos celulares y accesorios para los mismos, hoy en día cuenta con un capital de trabajo un poco más alto que cuando dio inicio a su negocio pero los sueños de ser una gran empresaria y de agrandar su negocio no han quedado atrás.
Es por tal motivo que Xiomara desea realizar un préstamo para comprar más accesorios para celulares como auriculares, baterías, cables USB entre otros. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de gran ayuda porque de esta manera podrá ofrecerles a todos sus una mayor variedad de artículos. Entre sus principales metas están aumentar sus ventas, diversificar más los productos que ofrece y en un futuro lograr trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Nowadays we are living in a world that is beginning to move day by day according to technology and and none of us are excluded, as from the youngest to the eldest in the family, we own tech items. That was how four years ago Xiomara saw the need that many people living in her community had, and with some small savings she had, decided to start her own business selling tech items such as cell phones and accessories. 

Now she has a bit more working capital than when she started her business, but she has not abandoned her dreams of being a successful businessperson and of expanding her business. It is for this reason that Xiomara wishes to obtain a loan to buy more cell phone accessories such as headphones, batteries, USB cables and other items. She believes the loan requested will be a great help to her because in this way she will be able to offer all of her customers a greater variety of items. Among her principal goals are to increase sales, diversify the products she sells, and someday succeed in working with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy more cell phone accessories such as headphones, batteries, USB cables and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grazing cattle, and beans, sugar, salt, sweets, biscuits, drinks and more for her shop.

loans.name: Esteban Adrián

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 39 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta 6º grado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa, tiene cuatro hijos y todos están casados, por lo que solo su esposa vive con él.

Esteban trabaja en la agricultura y con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho desde niño y lo aprendió de sus padres que eran agricultores, su trabajo le queda cerca por lo que se va a pie y sale a las 12:00 pm y le ayuda un hijo que vive cerca de el.

El dinero del préstamo será invertido para construir una fosa séptica, ademas para comprar sacos de abono para la milpa.
 

Los sueños de Esteban es tener ganado de repasto y lechero para que en su vejez pueda trabajar menos y tener los suficientes recursos económicos para poder mantener a su esposa, sabe que con la ayuda de Dios lo lograra.
texts.en:
Esteban is 39 years old and had the opportunity to study up to sixth grade at school. His wife looks after the household chores. The couple has four children, all of whom are now married. Esteban and his wife live alone.

Esteban works in farming; he has grazing cattle. Esteban has done this work since he was a child, having learned the trade from his parents who were also farmers. Esteban's work is close to his home and he can arrive there on foot. He finishes work at noon and receives help from one of his sons.

This loan will be used to build a septic tank and buy bags of manure for his cornfield.

Esteban's dreams are to have grazing and dairy cows so that, in his old age, he can work less and have enough money to support his wife. Esteban knows that, with God's help, he will achieve these dreams.

loans.use: to build a septic tank and buy bags of manure for his cornfield.

loans.name: El Buen Sembrador - Cruz B3 Group

texts.es: Gregorio Rufino tiene 36 años de edad, (aparece en la foto de tercero , de izquierda a derecha, viste camisa a cuadros color rojo), vive en el municipio de Santa Lucía Utatlán, departamento de Sololá, solicita nuevamente crédito, el crédito del año pasado le dejó muchos beneficios  ya que no tiene preocupación en la alimentación de su familia para este año, el maíz tiene demanda en la comunidad porque es la base de la alimentación de las familia y lo que no consumirán Gregorio Rufino lo venderá para obtener un ingreso más, anteriormente Gregorio Rufino le costaba mucho obtener capital porque nadie le prestaba, Gregorio Rufino necesita nuevamente crédito para comprar insumos (abono químico)  para el mantenimiento de maíz, al tener el crédito Gregorio Rufino puede tener otras metas ya le permite disponer de su capital, Gregorio Rufino quiere volver a tener la cosecha del año pasado.
texts.en: Gregorio Rufino is 36 years old (he is third on the left in the photo, wearing a red checked shirt) and lives in the Santa Lucía Utatlán municipality of the Sololá department. Gregorio is applying for another loan. The loan for which he applied last year was very beneficial for him as he did not have to worry about feeding his family this year. Corn is in demand in Gregorio's community as it is a staple food for families. What Gregorio's family does not eat, he sells to earn an extra income. Previously it was expensive for Gregorio to find capital as few people would loan it to him. Gregorio is applying for another loan in order to buy supplies (chemical manure) to look after his corn. With this loan, Gregorio can have other goals in life as he has more capital. Gregorio wants to have as good a harvest as last year.

loans.use: to buy supplies for looking after coffee crops.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi is 53 years old and married with eight children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years. 

Tasi needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, sprayers, safety equipment, and a chainsaw. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Tasi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, sprayers, safety equipment, and a chainsaw

loans.name: Konileti

texts.en:
Konileti is a 44 year old woman with ten children. 

She has a small plantation business from which she sells to the members of her community or to the public. Her partner also helps out in fishing while her children and herself help sell his catch as another means of earning money. 

With this loan money, Konileti plans to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fencing wire, bushknives, and a blade sharpner to better improve her business.

She joined the SPBD program in 2013 to gain access to financial services. Konileti hopes to improve on her business so that she would be able to provide a better living for her large family and meet their weekly financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fencing wire, bushknives, and a blade sharpner

loans.name: Sailau

texts.en:
Sailau is a 70-year-old widow with two children. Though she is old, she is still active and healthy, running her small shop at the village. 

She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than three years now and is still maintaining a well-run shop. 

With this loan money, Sailau plans to purchase sacks of sugar, flour, rice, boxes of canned fish, corned beef, milk, noodles, snacks, Tang, soft drinks, nappies, sausages, etc., to restock her shop. 

Sailau has managed to contribute to taking care of her family without too much reliance on her relatives.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, flour, rice, boxes of canned fish, corned beef, milk, noodles, snacks, Tang, soft drinks, nappies, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Isu

texts.en:
Isu is a 29-year-old woman with two children. She has joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. 

She wants to start a barbeque business, selling to the members of her community and also to the traveling public. Therefore, she plans to use this money to purchase boxes of chicken leg quarters, sausages, mutton flaps, potatoes, soya, tomato sauce, and taro for her business. 

Isu hopes to make a lot of profit from business so that she can assist in meeting her family's weekly financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of chicken leg quarters, sausages, mutton flaps, potatoes, soya, tomato sauce, and taro

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 19-year-old single lady who wants to help her family meet their weekly financial obligations. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial services. 

She is currently running a flea market block in town, selling different vegetable goods and crops. She plans to use this money to purchase sacks of cucumber, eggplants, pumpkins, and Samoan koko to restock her flea market. 

Maria hopes to sell more varieties of crops in her stall so that she would be able to make a lot of profit  to improve their family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cucumber, eggplants, pumpkins, and Samoan koko

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en:
Lamosa is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. 

She runs a small flea market stall selling handicrafts and souvenirs. She wants to expand the variety of stocks sold in her stall. 

This is why she has just joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase Ava bowls, orator sticks and fue (fan like), and sinew strings for her flea market stall. 

Lamosa hopes to make a lot of profit from the variety that she will be selling in her business so that she would be able to improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase Ava bowls, orator sticks and fue (fan like), and sinew strings to sell at her local handicraft stall

loans.name: Tuiano

texts.en:
Tuiano is a 21-year-old single lady who has decided to run a sewing and elei business to help out with the financial obligations of her family. 

She will be assisted by her siblings and that is why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase fabric materials and  fabric paint for her sewing and elei business. 

Tuiano hopes to make a lot of profit from her business so that she would be able to contribute to the improvement of her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials and fabric paint

loans.name: Amu

texts.en:
Amu is a 41-year-old divorcee with four children. She has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance.

She has decided to help out in taking care of her family without depending on others. That is why she wants to run her meat bun and vegetable garden business and her children will help her out. 

With this money, Amu plans to  purchase chemicals, a mist-blower, and fertilizers for her vegetable garden, as well as flour, baking powder, cooking oil, soya, a large cooking pot, and a pan for her meat bun business. 

Amu hopes to save most of her profits so that she would be able to provide for her family's essential needs.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, a mistblower, fertilizers, flour, baking powder, cooking oil, soya, a large cooking pot, and a pan

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky ia s 35-year-old woman with 2 children. She runs a small stall at the town flea market to sell to the public and tourists. This is the second year she has been with the SPBD program. 

Her partner of 6 years, helps her with her business. She plans to use this money to purchase souvenir handicrafts, baskets, jewelry, traditional head dresses, grass skirts, table mats, and mats. 

Vicky makes good profit from her business and hopes to continue to manage it well.  She wants to help meet their family's weekly essential needs.

loans.use: to purchase souvenir handicrafts, baskets,  jewelry, traditional head dresses, grassskirts, table mats, and mats.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 60-year-old widow with six children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Ana needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, a spade, and lots of crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Ana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, a spade, and lots of crops

loans.name: Faalaniga

texts.en:
Faalaniga is a 28-year-old unmarried woman with 3 children. She earns a living by operating a small bakery in her community. She has 9 years of experience with this business. 

Faalaniga needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families' weekly expenses. 

Faalaniga has been a member of SPBD since 2005.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married woman with five children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income raising pigs. Myrna requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net for her business.

Myrna has sustained her business activities through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Dieu Beni Group

texts.fr:
Mme AÏSSATA est responsable du groupe DIEU BENI. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et  a 01personne en charge.
Mme vend du jus depuis  06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter  01sac de bissap, 01sac de sucre, 01sac de petit mil, 01paquet de sachet et 05plats de pain de singe.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne diversifier son commerce et assurer la santé de sa mère.
texts.en:
Mme AÏSSATA is the leader of the Dieu Beni group. She is single and has no children of her own, but has one person in her care. 
She has sold juice for a living for 6 years, and sources her goods from the market in town. 
She would like to purchase one bag of hibiscus tea, one bag of sugar, one bag of millet, one pack of sachets and 5 plates of pain de singe (baobab fruit). She would like to use her profits in order to boost her business. She aims to diversify her business and look after her mother's health.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of hibiscus tea, one bag of sugar, one bag of millet, one pack of sachets and 5 plates of pain de singe (baobab fruit)

loans.name: Logo

texts.en:
Logo is a 40-year-old married woman with 3 children. She runs a gardening business to sell  to community members and the public. 

She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than 4 years and her business is doing well. She plans to use this money to purchase pots, flower seeds, and fertilizers for her gardening business.  She will also purchase timber and iron roofing for her home renovation and pay her children's school fees. 

Logo has managed to make a lot of improvements to her family's livelihood and hopes to continue to do so through saving as much of her profit as possible.

loans.use: to purchase pots, flower seeds, fertilizer, timber, and iron roofing materials and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Maotua

texts.en:
Maotua is a 24-year-old single woman. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Maotua needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Maotua will use the profits from her sales to pay for families' weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes, handbags, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is a 25-year-old married woman with one child.

She has earned a living raising pigs for 3 years and earns additional income from a general store . Airen requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vaifoa

texts.en:
Vaifoa is a 28-year-old single woman with 5 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. 

Vaifoa requests a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay her families' weekly expenses. 

She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de 53 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se dedica a realizar viajes en su camión desde hace 15 años lo que le ha permitido tener clientes fijos a quienes le realiza los viajes. La compañera de vida de Ricardo lo  apoya económicamente con la venta de frutas y verduras que realiza en el mercado de su Municipio. Ricardo desea comprar un portón para colocar en la entrada de su vivienda y así dar mayor protección a su familia. Por lo anterior  solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar un portón y pagar mano de obra para la instalación del mismo.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 53 years old, lives with his life partner and his 8-year-old child. He is a proactive man who has earned a living by making journeys with his truck for the last 15 years. This has allowed him to secure fixed clients, for whom he carries out the journeys. Ricardo’s life partner contributes economically by selling fruits and vegetables in the market in their town. 
Ricardo would like to buy a gate to put at the entrance to his house in order to better protect his family. For this, he requested a loan from FUSAI to buy a gate and pay the labor costs to have it installed.

loans.use: to buy a gate and pay the labor costs to have it installed.

loans.name: Amorlita

texts.en:
Amorlita is a 31-year- old married woman with six children; five children are currently in school.

Amorlita buys and sells livestock and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase livestock to sell.  She has been buying and selling livestock for 3 years and has borrowed 5 previous times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Amorlita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  livestock to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a married woman with six children, Betty works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business and earns additional income selling dried fish.  Betty requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and wants a new loan to further build her general store business.  Betty has sustained her business activities through 7 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josue Jheferzon

texts.es: Josué, tiene 23 años de edad, esta casado, vive con su esposa en el municipio de Santa, Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Josué estudio Mecánica y hace 5 años estableció su propio taller de reparación de motocicletas. Este negocio lo tiene en un puesto del mercado local donde repara todo tipo de motocicletas. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas de trabajo como ser desarmadores, llaves y gato hidráulico que necesita en su taller para brindar mejor servicio. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y poder tener buenos ingresos para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Josué is 23 years old, married, and lives with his wife in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. He studied mechanics and established his own motorcycle repair shop five years ago. His business is located at a space in the local market where he repairs all types of motorcycles.

The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 6,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of work tools such as screwdrivers, wrenches, and a hydraulic lift. He needs these items in his shop so that he can provide better service. His plan is to grow his business so that he can generate a good income in order to live better.

loans.use: to buy work tools such as screwdrivers, wrenches, and a hydraulic lift.

loans.name: Ambatiessiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe AMBATIESSIRI III est constitué de  femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants. La plupart d’entre eux vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Dioni un des villages de la préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe AMBATIESSIRI III collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (mil, arachide, sésame, haricot etc.) 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Madame FATOUMATA, troisième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheter de la semence, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 1 hectare d’arachide.
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Konobougou.
Elle envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 80 000F CFA par campagne qui sera en parti investi dans le commerce.
Les femmes du groupe AMBATIESSIRI III se disent satisfaites de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable et fructueuse.
texts.en:
The Ambatiessiri III group is made up of married women who are aged 44 years old on average, and have 3 children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Dioni, one of the villages in the Baroueli prefecture, in the Segou region (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The women of the Ambatiessiri III group work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organise their winter activities. They cultivate, among other things, millet, peanuts, sesame and beans etc. 
They are on their seventh loan with the organisation. 
With this loan, Madame Fatoumata, the third person standing (from left to right) in the back row, aims to pay the costs of labour and hoeing, as well as purchasing seeds, fertiliser, herbicide and other basic tools in order to manage her 1 hectare peanut field. After cultivation, the crops are sold for cash in Konobougou.  She aims to realise an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA per harvest which will partly be reinvested in the business. 
The women of the Ambatiessiri III group have indicated that they are happy with their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and have confidence in a strong and fruitful agricultural harvest.

loans.use: Labour, seeds, fertiliser, herbicide, hoeing and basic tools

loans.name: Mirna Sonia

texts.es: Mirna de 43 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 3 años vendiendo  diversidad de flores en el mercado central, su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar con su trabajo en un taller. Mirna desea terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, grava, arena, hierro, lámina, polines y pernos, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la finalización de la construcción de su cuarto.
texts.en:
Mirna, 43 years of age, lives with her life partner and 2 children, 17 and 14 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has made a living for the past 3 years selling a variety of flowers in the central market. Her life partner contributes to the family economy with his job in a workshop.

Mirna hopes to finish building a room in her house, which is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy: bricks, cement, gravel, sand, iron, metal sheets, beams, and bolts, as well as to pay for labor to finalize the construction of her room.

loans.use: to buy:  cement, gravel, bricks, sand, iron, metal sheets, beams, and bolts, and also to pay for labor to finish building a room in her house.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en:
Deolinda is a 51-year-old married woman with twelve children;  three children attend school.

Deolinda raises cattle and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional cattle for her business.

Deolinda has been raising cattle for 3 years and has borrowed 5 previous times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Deolinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her business.

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos solo estudió hasta 3º grado, está soltera pues se separó de su compañero de vida, tiene tres hijas de las cuales solo una está con ella, ya que las dos mayores están en E.E.U.U, por lo que una persona depende de ella.

María actualmente trabaja en la agricultura, y lo ha hecho desde que era niña y lo aprendió de sus padres, se traslada cerca de 1 kilómetro a pie hasta llegar donde tiene la parcela, horario no tiene pues hasta que termina lo que se tiene programado hacer ese día regresa a casa.

El dinero del préstamo será invertido para comprar  abono para la milpa que ya tiene sembrada y para pagar empleados ya que no puede hacer todo el trabajo.

Los sueños de María son tener una mejor vivienda porque donde vive es de su hermano, también poder darle todo el estudio necesario a su hija para que tenga una mejor oportunidad de vida de la que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old, and because of limited financial resources only went to school through 3rd grade.  She has been single since separating from her life companion.  Maria has three daughters, one of whom lives with her.  The two older ones are in the United States, so only one depends on Maria.

Maria has worked as a farmer  since childhood, learning from her parents.  She travels almost 1 kilometer on foot to get to where her field is located.  She has no fixed schedule but works until finishing what she planned for the day before going home. The loan money will be used to buy fertilizer for the corn field which she has already sown and to pay employees because she can no longer do all the work herself.

Maria's dreams are to have a better place to live, since she currently lives in her brother's house.  She also wants to provide the education her daughter needs to have better opportunities in life than Maria has had.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the cornfield she has already sown, and pay employees since she can no longer do all the work

loans.name: Ana Yalci

texts.es:
Ana de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º grado de educación básica, esta casada; su esposo es pensionado, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno vive en casa y un nieto, su hijo no estudia ni trabaja porque tiene una discapacidad y la otra hija tiene su propio hogar. 

Ana administra su propia tienda desde hace 10 años y lo hizo por iniciativa propia. Decidio hacerlo para obtener un ingreso economico mejor, tambien los fines de semana hace pupusas para vender, no tenia negocio antes. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y se involucra su esposo en el negocio. Su horario de atencion a los clientes es de 6:00 am a 6:30 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arrroz, frijoles, azucar, pan, lácteos, embuditos, dulces, detergentes, etc para surtir su tienda. Le mejorara su negocio porque podra ofrecer diferentes productos a sus clientes y por lo tanto tendra mejores ingresos economicos y asi mismo mejor calidad de vida. Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio, el préstamo le ayudara mucho porque podra surtir la tienda y las ganancias las utiliza para su familia y para ir pagando el préstamo y asi poder salir muy bien con los compromisos crediticios y asi poder aspirar a un credito mayor para poder ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 45 years of age, studied until the 2nd grade. She is married, and her husband is retired. She has 2 children, only one of whom lives at home, and a grandson. Her son doesn't study or work, because he has a disability, and the daughter has her own home.

Ana has run her own store for 10 years, and she did it of her own initiative. She decided to do it to get better earnings. On the weekends, she also makes pupusas to sell. She did not have a business before.

She has the business in her house, and her husband is involved in the business. Her schedule for attending to customers is 6:00 am to 6:30 pm.

The loan that she is applying to CREDICAMPO for is to buy rice, beans, sugar, bread, dairy products, cold cuts, sweets, detergents, etc. to stock her store. Her business will improve because she will be able to offer her customers different products, and thus get better earnings as well as a better quality of life.

Her dreams are to expand her business. The loan will help her a lot, because she will be able to stock the store. She will use the earnings for her family, and to pay back the loan, and thus be able to do well with her financial commitments and aspire to a larger loan to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, bread, dairy products, cold cuts, sweets, detergents, etc., to stock her store.  Her business will improve because she will be able to offer her customers different products, and thus have better earnings as well as a better quality of life.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona: Es una mujer amable y sociable, originaria de Rosita, tiene 32 años de edad, , casada tiene 3 hijos, 2 adolescentes  que cursan su primaria y una menor de edad con problemas psicomotores. Su esposo es albañil. Con el propósito de generar sus propios ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 6 meses estableció una pequeña pulpería, en un anexo de su vivienda de tambo de madera, inicio con capital propio con C$ 12,000 (Doce mil Córdobas Netos). Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar una vitrina y ofrecer repostería, granos básicos, chiverías, pollo, embutidos, huevo, gaseosas, cuajadas, jugos sopas y café instantáneas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero, ya que se encuentra ubicado en un punto estratégico frente a una de las universidades del municipio.
texts.en:
Petrona is a friendly and sociable woman who is originally from Rosita. She is 32 years old, married, and has two teenage children. One child is in school and the other suffers from psychomotor disabilities. Her husband works as a bricklayer. In order to generate her own income and help with the household expenses, Petrona established a small store six months ago. It is located in an extension of her wooden stilt home. She started with her own capital of 12,000 NIO.

Petrona is requesting her first loan in order to buy a display cabinet. She will offer pastries, basic staples, yogurt, chicken, sausages, eggs, sodas, curds, juices, soaps, instant coffee, and other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business at a strategic location in front of one of the universities in town.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and various products to sell in her store.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos que viven con ellos por lo que dos personas dependen de ella.

María actualmente ayuda a su pareja a trabajar en la agricultura, además trabaja de doméstica en la casa de los vecinos y lo aprendió de sus padres, se traslada junto a su esposo 4 kilómetros en bicicleta para poder llegar donde tienen la parcela y terminan de trabajar a las 11:00 am.


El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar abono ya que tiene sembrada la milpa y así poder terminar la cosecha.


Los sueños de María son tener una vivienda donde vivir porque actualmente alquilan, también poder ver crecer a sus hijos y darles todo lo necesario para que sean unas personas de bien.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and studied through 9th grade.  She is in a relationship and her partner works as a farmer.  They have two children who live with them, so two people depend on Maria..

Maria helps her partner work at farming, and also works as a maid in her neighbors' home, having learned this work from her parents.  With her spouse, she travels 4 kilometers on a bicycle to get to their piece of land.  They finish working on the land at 11 AM.  

The loan money will be used to  buy fertilizer since she has sown the cornfield and thus will be able to complete the harvest.

Maria's dreams are to have a home to live in since now they rent one.  She also wants to see her children grow up and give them everything needed so that they can be good people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the corn field she has already seeded, and thus be able to complete the harvest

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en: Abdullahi is a 45-year-old farmer from Bakutaje.  As a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Abdullahi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Abdullahi is ambitious and is aiming to reap 60 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Abdullahi said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Habibu, Barahama,and Daiyabu, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en: La'azarus is a 45 year old farmer from Pegi.  As a Babban Gona member, La'azarus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, La'azarus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, La'azarus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 per hectare this season. When asked, La'azarus said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 49 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, etc. to sell.

Eva has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a dedicated small holder farmer from Yalwan Pegi.  As a Babban Gona member, Garba is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Garba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Garba is ambitious and is aiming to reap a total of 80 bags on his 1.20 ha field this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children Aminu, Ado, and  Harisu. My overall goal is to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Tiaina

texts.en: Tiaina is 25 years old, single, and has three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Tiaina needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, a spade, and gloves. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Tiaina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, a spade, and gloves

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADENYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Belena, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration et le commerce de condiments. 
Les femmes du groupe BADENYA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, personne assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, de l’oignon, du cube Maggi et des condiments chez les grossistes a Massigui. La vente se fait en espèce dans sa gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Badenya group is made up of married women, who are all around 42 years old, with 6 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Belena, in the Dioila prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family, neighbours and friends. They sell prepared food and condiments. 
The Badenya group women are on their sixth loan. 
In order to satisfy their customers' growing demand, they are seeking a new loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 
Faoutmata, the lady sitting down, is illiterate, and works in food preparation. She aims to purchase rice, onions, Maggi stock cubes and condiments from the wholesalers in Massigui. She will sell her wares for cash at her small restaurant, to a mixed customer base. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which she will reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 46 years old and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is married.

Felicisima is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock like pigs, goats, etc. for her business.

Felicisima has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felicisima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock like pigs and goats

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a dedicated small holder farmer and mother of three.  As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Maryamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Maryamu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 50 bags of maize per hectare this season. Maryamu is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children Mahamaya,Suleiman,and Mary. Maryamu’s dreams do not end here “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” she said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a dedicated farmer and father of three from Kaduna.  As a Babban Gona member, Idris, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Idris can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Idris is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in higher yields this season.  Idris is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children. Idris’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Vengadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VENGADORAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Central, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luz es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de combustible, peluquería, venta de golosinas, venta de prendas de vestir.

Después de la inundación que hubo en Trinidad muchas microempresarias fueron afectadas, ya que perdieron gran parte de su mercadería y sus herramientas de trabajo. La señora Luz  indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución; Ella cuenta que después de este desastre natural, que afecto a su familia, decidió retomar su actividad económica, ya que es su única fuente de producción; el negocio que tiene es la venta de comida, da a conocer que este negocio lo hace un año ganado mayor clientela con la atención que le da a sus clientes, estrategias que aprendió en Pro Mujer. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el pago del espacio de venta donde quiere comercializar sus productos, ya que tiene un saldo pendiente, posteriormente este lugar será el lugar de ubicación de la cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo y las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución para restablecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The "VENGADORAS" ["Avengers"] communal bank will start its third lending cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Central regional office. It is composed of ten members and led by a board of directors, of which Luz is the president. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied; among them are food sales, fuel sales, a hair salon, candy sales, and garment sales.

Luz states that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago, coming in on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. After the flood that occurred in Trinidad, many small businesses were affected because they lost a large portion of their merchandise and work equipment. Luz says that after that natural disaster, which affected her family, she decided to return to her economic activity since it is her only source of productivity. Her business is food sales. She points out that during the last year, she has won more clientele with the service that she gives her customers, a strategy that she learned in Pro Mujer.

The loan that she is now taking out is to pay for a sales space where she wants to sell her products, as she has an outstanding balance. Afterward, this place will be the site of Luz's business. Working this way will allow her to generate resources to support her family, as she lives with her partner and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the support and the training that the institution is offering her to reestablish her business.

loans.use: to pay for a sales space

loans.name: Audi

texts.en: Audi remembers the starvation his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Audi, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Audi is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Audi expressed that in 5 years, he would like to make more money for himself and his family.” With this loan, Audi is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Khurelbagana

texts.en: Khurelbagana, 36 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling running shoes to local people since 2011. His wife stays at home, looking after their children and taking care of domestic work. Their elder two sons go to school. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy a variety of running shoes in a large quantity at a wholesale price so that he can run his business without worrying about inventory shortage. Running shoe sales is the only income generator for his family and he wants to succeed in this business and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy running shoes in a large quantity.

loans.name: Faapepele

texts.en: Faapepele is a 32-year-old single woman with 1 child. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Faapepele needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faapepele has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Perla works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell.

Perla has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, candies, etc. 

Perla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 44 years old and has one child. Liezel is married and her child is in school.

Liezel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Liezel has been raising pigs for 5 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 37 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Lorena works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, cereals and other groceries to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, cereals and other groceries. 

In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, milk, coffee, cereals and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.en:
Maria Josefina works hard to support her family. Maria Josefina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Josefina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Maria Josefina has been in this business for 30 years now.

Maria Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 29 years old and has three children. Marivic is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marivic has been in pig fattening for 2 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda works hard to support her family. Maylinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maylinda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maylinda has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Maylinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Salvacion has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 32 years old and single. Shiela works very hard.

Shiela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Shiela has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, juice, canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Shiela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 37 años de edad, no estudió ningún grado debido a la pobreza de su  familia, su pareja le ayuda a trabajar, tienen dos hijos que viven en su casa y están estudiando, por lo que son 3 personas las que dependen de él.

Nelson se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho desde niño y lo aprendió de sus padres y para todo esto le ayuda su pareja, hora de entrada o salida no tiene, pues aveces termina bien tarde o termina temprano.


El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar un par de terneros que en término de un año le estará dando ganancias y así es como piensa salir adelante con su familia.

Los sueños de Nelson son poder darles estudio a sus hijos para que ellos no sufran lo que el tuvo que sufrir, también poder tener ganado lechero, para que esto en su vejez le pueda hacer mas fácil su vida.
texts.en:
Nelson is 37 years old. He never attended school because he comes from a poor family.  His wife helps him with his work. They have two school-aged children so Nelson has three dependents.

He is a farmer and also raises beef cattle, work he's been doing ever since he was a child. He learned about farming from his parents, and his wife helps him with everything.  He doesn't have set hours of work--sometimes he works till late, sometimes he finishes early.

Nelson plans to use the loan to buy two calves, which, after a year has passed, will bring in some income. In this way he hopes to improve the lot of his family. Nelson's hopes for the future include providing his children with a good education so they don't have to suffer as he has suffered, and to have some milk cows so that he will have an easier life when he is old.

loans.use: Buy two calves which will earn him money after a year

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena es de estado civil casada,  vive en la población de Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba, tiene a su cargo un dependiente económico que es su hijo quien está estudiando en un instituto superior,  tiene una casa propia pero es antigua (rustica) no tiene obra fina,  tiene dos  actividades a las que se dedica junto a su esposo la primera es la actividad agrícola, produce papa, haba y maíz en sus propios terrenos que están ubicados en el mismo lugar donde vive, la otra actividad es la venta de mote de tarwi de lunes a viernes para tener mayores ingresos, pero ahora no tiene suficientes recursos  razón por la cual se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta para su hijo destinada a su transporte para evitar el gasto de pasajes porque su hijo tiene que ir a diario una larga distancia hasta su instituto.
texts.en:
Elena is a married woman who lives in the village of Tiraque, in Cochabamba department. She has one economic dependent, her son, who studies in a secondary school. She has her own house, but it is old (rustic) and has no finishing work. 

She has two occupations that allow her to earn a living, together with her husband. The first is agriculture. They grow potatoes, broad beans, and corn on the land they own next to their home. The other business is selling boiled tarwi from Monday to Friday to generate more income. 

But, for the moment, their resources are insufficient, and for this reason she must request a loan to buy a motorbike for her son in order to avoid paying transportation costs, because her son must travel a long distance every day to attend school.

loans.use: to pay for her son's transportation to school

loans.name: Iulia

texts.en:
Iulia is a 54-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small vegetable garden and earns a living by selling her produce in the local market. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Iulia needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a tiller, a sprayer, a new chainsaw, and new gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a tiller, a sprayer, a new chainsaw, and new gloves

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She has been in this business for 11 years. She also earns more income from fishing and food vending.

Jenny is borrowing 30,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business and fattens pigs in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 10 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to sustain it.

She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with two children. She is 25 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Jocelyn has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur and has been in this business for three years. 

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Liberta

texts.es:
María es una señora de 37 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta primer grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivían sus padres, ahora en día es una mujer acompañada y madre de cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 7 y 2 años de edad, de los cuales tres se encuentran estudiando. María y su compañero de vida se dedican a la crianza de cerdos, a la agricultura y a la hortaliza desde hace 12 años, para llegar a su trabajo ellos caminan 2 kilómetros todos los días y trabajan de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando María en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar concentrado para cerdos y así podrá engordarlos para venderlos y poder obtener un poco mas de ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor alimentación y un mejor vivir.

El sueño de María es poder aumentar la crianza de cerdos, poder darle a sus hijos estudio hasta que se preparen y poder pagar el préstamo que adquirió con la institución para quedar con un buen record.
texts.en:
Maria, 37, is a housewife. She studied up until first grade but could not continue with her studies due to her family's poverty. Today, she has a partner and four children aged 12, 10, 7 and 2 years old, three of which are at school. 

Maria and her partner have worked in pig farming, agriculture and growing vegetables for 12 years. To get to work, they walk two kilometers every day and work from 7 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon. 

Maria is asking CREDICAMPO for a loan to buy food pellets to fatten up her pigs and sell them for a little more profit to be able to provide her family with better food and a better quality of life.

Maria's dream is to increase the number of pigs to let her children go to school and to repay the loan she receives and keep up her good record.

loans.use: to buy food pellets to fatten her pigs and sell them for a little more profit to be able to provide her family with better food and a better quality of life.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business and fattens pigs in the Philippines. She has been in the pig fattening business for 10 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to sustain it.

She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Catalina Beatriz

texts.es:
Catalina es una jovencita de 20 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta noveno grado no siguió estudiando porque decidió acompañarse, es madre de 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, los cuales dependen de ella, su compañero de vida trabaja en un restaurante mientras que Catalina se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace tres años trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, para trasladarse a su trabajo catalina camina tres kilómetros, trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de 438 metros cuadrados de terreno, eso le ayudara para aumentar el trabajo en la siembra de hortalizas como tomate, chile, cebolla etc., para poder darle una mejor alimentación a su grupo familiar y poder tener mejores ingresos económicos y cancelar mas rápido el crédito.

Catalina sueña en tener mejores ingresos económicos con el trabajo de las hortalizas y poder darles un mejor estudio a sus hijos y en su terreno poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Catalina, 20, studied until the ninth grade but did not continue studying because she decided to work herself. She has two children, 4 and 1, who are dependent on her. Her partner works in a restaurant while Catalina has been working planting vegetables for three years. She learned this work from her parents and walks three kilometers every day, working from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon.

She is asking CREDICAMPO for a loan to buy 438 square meters of land that will help increase her work flow planting vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers and onions to be able to provide better food for her families and receive better financial income and cancel credit quicker.

Catalina dreams of having a better income with her work and being able to provide better studies for her children and build their own home on their land.

loans.use: to buy 438 square meters of land for planting pepper, tomato, onion etc..

loans.name: La Ceiba Group

texts.es:
MARIA. Mujer de 30 años. Vive con su esposo  y con 4 hijos. Su esposo es agricultor en un lejano pueblo llamado “LA CEIBA CHACHI”  sus hijos asisten con normalidad a clases su casita es propia de construcción de madera y techo de paja, como es nativo de la comunidad. 
Son una familia pobre y de escasos recursos.  En su pequeño pueblo cuentan con 1 escuela y una capilla. No cuentan con servicios básicos de agua potable y los servicios de transporte son escasos hasta la comunidad. Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en FODEMI y continuara con la actividad de cría de pollos ya que ha podido obtener  resultados positivos para solventar gastos del hogar. Además, una parte del recurso lo destinara a la compra venta de borojó (fruta exótica de la zona de valor considerable).
En un futuro no muy lejano. Espera crecer en el negocio de venta de borojó y entregar a los compradores mayoristas. Tener más pollos y poder venderlos semanalmente en san Lorenzo y en comunidades cercanas.
INFORMACIÓN ADICIONAL.
