Este es el segundo crédito gestionado por el grupo LA CEIBA donde los integrantes antiguos recibirán $700,00 y los integrantes nuevos (5) recibirán $400,00. Viven en la comunidad “LA CEIBA CHACHI” (comunidad de costumbres ancestrales)
texts.en:
Maria is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer in the remote town of La Ceiba Chachi. Her children regularly attend classes. Maria owns a small wooden house that has a thatched roof, which is native to the community.

Her family is poor and has limited resources. They live in a small town that only has one school and a chapel. The town does not receive basic services, such as running water, and transportation services are limited throughout the community. This is the second loan she has received from FODEMI. Maria continues to raise chickens since has obtained positive results that have helped her to cover household expenses. In addition, part of the loan will be used to buy “borojó” (a local exotic fruit that has considerable value).

In the near future, Maria hopes to grow her business of selling “borojó” and deliver those products to wholesale buyers. She has more chickens and sells them on a weekly basis in San Lorenzo and the neighboring communities.

Additional Information:
This is the second loan that has been issued to the group “La Ceiba”. The longtime members will receive $700 each and the new members (5) will receive $400 each. They live in the community of La Ceiba Chachi, which is known for its ancestral traditions.

loans.use: to invest in her business of raising chickens and to buy “borojó” fruit to sell.

loans.name: D. Hassan

texts.en: D. Hassan is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. D. Hassan expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led D. Hassan to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, D. Hassan can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, D. Hassan is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, D. Hassan will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, D. Hassan will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been in pig fattening for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Verónica Raquel

texts.es:
Verónica de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta el bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a hacer viajes en un pick-up, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando por lo que son dos personas las que dependen de ella.

Verónica actualmente tiene una tienda en su casa, además vende comida típica por las tardes, esto lo realiza desde hace 12 años debido a las pocas oportunidades de trabajo. Para vender la comida típica se traslada de un cantón a otro, camina cerca de 3 kilómetros todos los días.


El dinero del préstamo será invertido para surtir su tienda y para comprar un par de novillas que pronto le dará leche.

Ella sueña con tener una tienda muy surtida para que le genere mas ingresos económicos y así poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, está segura que con la ayuda de Dios y los prestamos podrá hacerlo posible.
texts.en:
Verónica is 29 years old and completed High school. She is in a relationship and has two children who are studying and are dependent on her. Her partner works providing transport with his pick-up truck. Verónica has a store in her house and she sells traditional food in the evenings. She has been doing this for 12 years, given the lack of opportunity for employment. To sell the traditional food she goes from one canton to another, walking about 3 km each day.

The money from the loan will be used to stock her store and to buy a pair of calves that soon will produce milk. She dreams of having a well-stocked store which would generate more revenues, then she could get her children ahead. She is sure that with the help of God and the loans it is possible to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store and buy a pair of calves who will soon produce milk.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 55 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como empleado un centro comercial desde hace 12 años.  Jorge desea construir un muro de contención en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: bloque de concreto, arena, grava, cemento y piedra, además deberá pagar mano de obra para dicha construcción.
texts.en: Jorge is 55 years old and lives with his life companion. He is a hard-working man who has made his living as an employee at a shopping mall for the last 12 years. Jorge wants to build a retaining wall at his house. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cinder blocks, sand, gravel, stones and he also has to pay for labor for this construction.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, sand, gravel, cement and stone and to pay for labor to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en: Tolotea is 63 years old and a widow with seven children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Tolotea needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Tolotea will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: José Oscar

texts.es:
José tiene 48 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos estudió hasta 3º grado, su pareja vende en un chalet de una escuela, tienen tres hijos de los cuales 2 viven con él y son los únicos que dependen de José

José se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y con ganado de repasto, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre y le ayudan sus dos hijos, horario específico no tiene, se traslada tres kilómetros en bicicleta para poder llegar donde trabaja  en la milpa.


El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto y surtir un poco mas el chalet de su esposa y así  tener mayores ingresos económicos. 


Los sueños de José son tener una tienda en su casa para que su esposa no salga, ayudar a sus hijos en todo lo necesario, sabe que será duro pero con la ayuda de Dios y los prestamos lo podrá hacer posible
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and due to a lack of economic resources only studied until Grade 3. His partner sells at the canteen of a school. He has three children, two of them live with him and they are the only people who are dependent on him.

José works in agriculture and raises cattle, work that he learned from his father. His two children help him and he has no set timetable. He travels 3 km by bicycle to get to his cornfield.

The money from the loan will be used to buy cattle and to stock his wife's canteen more so that they will have more revenues. José's dream is to have a store in their house so that his wife doesn't have to go out and to help his children anyway he can. He knows that it will be difficult but with the help of God and the loans it is possible for him to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy cattle and to stock his wife's business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Due to insufficient income, Beverly has been engaged in buying and selling various vegetables and fish within her community to help her husband in gaining income. She is 30 years old and has only one child. She and her husband aimed to improve their status of living to have a bright future. To attain this goal, Beverly wants to continue and improve her business. Having inadequate capital, she would like to ask a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks of fruits, vegetables and fish to resell. Having patience and strong determination, she is hoping that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits, vegetables and fish to resell.

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga is 31 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Aiga has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Chuluuntsetseg, 42 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been running a grocery store since 2013. Before this business, they bred livestock in a rural area and sold dairy products for a living. They have one daughter who is married and lives separately. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy food stuffs in large quantities in order to meet customer demand. During this period of time, lots of people from rural areas come to the capital city and buy food stuffs in large quantities. To continue operating a profitable business, she does not want to run out of goods during this busy season. She is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs in large quantities

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Adamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Usmanu, Nawasi, and  Suwidi. Adamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Adamu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Adamu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Adamu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en: Tasi is a 32 year old unwed woman with four children. She owns a small barbeque hut in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Tasi needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, soya sauce, tomato sauce, sausages, chicken leg quarters and a new BBQ set. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tasi has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, soya sauce, tomato sauce, sausages, chicken leg quarters and a new BBQ set

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chokwé Província de Gaza tem 31 anos de idade, casado oficialmente, é pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus pais que se encontram na Matola.
Trabalha no Governo como Técnico Profissional em Administração a mais de 5 anos, auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa bem como nos seus estudos. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e pedra para dar continuidade a sua obra. Este é seu 4º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e mobilar a mesma para garantir o conforto da sua família, tem como desafio concluir o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Born in the Chokwé Província of Gaza, Julio is 31 years old, married and the father of 2 children who are both minors. He's also responsible for his parents who are in Matola.

He has worked for the Government as an Administration Professional for more than 5 years, using the money he makes for household expenses and for his studies. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials like: sand, cement and stone to continue the building work on his house. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku.

In future he hopes to complete and furnish his house to guarantee his family's comfort. His main challenge is to finish his higher education.

loans.use: buy construction materials like: sand, cement and stone to continue the building work on his house

loans.name: Brenda Lissette

texts.es:
Brenda de 28 años de edad, ama de casa, estudio hasta el bachillerato por situaciones económicas no pudo continuar sus estudios, esta casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, es madre de dos hijos de 9 y 3 años el primero estudia segundo grado, la abuela es quien además vive con ellos. Brenda es empleada desde hace 6 años, dicidió trabajar para aportar a los gastos del hogar, para trasladarse a su trabajo Brenda camina cuatro kilómetros y medio de su casa diariamente, trabajando en el horario de 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM después de las 4:00 pm ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar. 

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución, será invertido en la compra de materiales como cemento, hierro, arena y ladrillo, para la construcción de una habitación en su casa, esto ayudara a proporcionar mejor ambiente en su casa y mayor comodidad.

Brenda sueña en tener un negocio propio, que los hijos sean profesionales para que en el futuro les vaya bien y también sueña con poder tener un terreno propio para la siembra de maíz (agrícola).
texts.en:
Brenda is 28 years old, married and a housewife. She completed her high schooling but could not continue her studies due to a lack of financial resources. Her husband works in agriculture. She has two children aged 3 and 9. The oldest one is in Grade 2. Their grandmother also lives with them.

Brenda has been an employee for 6 years. She decided to work to help pay the household expenses. She walks four and a half km from her house to get to her work every day. Her work schedule is from 7 am until 4 pm and after 4 pm she takes care of the housework.

The loan that she is requesting from the institution will be invested in the purchase of materials like cement, re-bar, sand and bricks to build a room onto their house. This will provide them with a better environment in their house and be more comfortable. Brenda dreams of having her own business and that her children become professionals so that they have a good future. She also dreams of having her own land to plant corn.

loans.use: to buy cement, re-bar, sand and bricks to build a room onto their house.

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, está casado y su esposa realiza los oficios domésticos del hogar, tienen una niña de 3 años.

Miguel inició a trabajar junto a su padre en la agricultura desde la edad de 12 años, también trabajaba como ayudante de albañilería, desde entonces aprendió muy bien el oficio y hoy ya es albañil. Además siembra junto a su esposa un área de 7,000 mts de cultivo de maíz, estas dos actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7 am a 4 pm. 

 El crédito sera invertido para comprar materiales de construcción y así poder construir su casa.

Lo que él mas desea es tener salud para sacar adelante a su familia, también piensa en trabajar muy duro para ayudarle a su hija a que estudie y pueda prepararse en educación, y lo mas importante es darle un buen ejemplo como padre.
texts.en:
30-year old Miguel has a grade 8 education. He is married and his wife works as a maid. They have a 3-year old daughter.

When he was 12 years old, Miguel started to work alongside his father in the fields. He also used to work as a helper in construction; he learned the trade very well and now he is a bricklayer. He and his wife also grow maize on a 7,000m plot of land. These two jobs are his source of income. Miguel works from 7 am to 4 pm.

The loan money will be used to buy construction materials so he can build a house.

Miguel's greatest wish is to stay healthy so he can help his family get on in life. He also wants to work very hard so he can support his daughter while she studies and gets an education. For Miguel, the most important thing is to be a good father.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies so he can build a house for his family

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 49 years old and blessed with five children. They are currently living in a rural community and earn their living through farming. Due to financial insufficiency, she wants to access financial assistance to further improve her hog-raising business. She wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Being a hard-working mother, she believes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Manito

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Vilankulos Província de Inhambane tem 31 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 é que frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha na sociedade de Água de Namaacha como operador de máquinas a mais de 6 anos, auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende adquirir um jogo de sofás para sua sala de estar. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Manito was born in the Vilankulos Province of Inhambane, is 31 years old, married and the father of 3 children, 1 of whom goes to school. He isn't responsible for supporting anyone else.

He has worked at the Água de Namaacha water company as a machine operator for the last 6 years, using the money he earns for household expenses and constructing his house. With this loan he plans to acquire a set of sofas for his living room. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku.

In future he plans to finish the building work on his house and to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: acquire a set of sofas for his living room

loans.name: Nelson

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 41 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 5 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe e pelos seus irmãos que se encontram no Maputo.
É negociante a mais de 5 anos, proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa assim como para ajudar os seus irmãos. Com este empréstimo pretende ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo mercadoria como: arroz, refrescos, sumos. Este é seu 6º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende ampliar os seus estabelecimentos comercias e adquirir uma camionete para o transporte da mercadoria.
 O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negocio para o sustento de crédito.
texts.en:
Nelson was born in the Namaacha Province of Maputo, is 41 years old and the father of 5 children who are all in school. He is also responsible for his mother and his brothers who live in Maputo.

He has been a trader for more than 5 years and owns a commercial establishment. The money he makes is used for household expenses and to help his brothers. With this loan he plans to expand his business by buying more products such as: rice, sodas and juices. This is his 6th loan with Hluvuku.

In future he plans to expand his commercial establishments and to buy a truck to transport his merchandise.

His biggest challenge is to keep his business going so that he can pay back his loan.

loans.use: expand his business by buying more products such as: rice, sodas and juices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, crackers, beverages and seasonings to resell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and married with six children. Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, eggs, detergent soap, canned goods, beers, etc. to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, eggs, detergent soap, canned goods, beers, etc. 

Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, soft-drinks, cooking oil, eggs, detergent soap, canned goods, beers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Khishigdavaa

texts.en: Mrs. Khishigdavaa, 49 years old, and lives with her husband and son in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as an assistant weaver at a carpet factory since 1996. Her husband is carpenter and works as a contract worker for private firms. Their son works as producer at a television studio. Using her previous loan, she purchased building materials and repaired her house. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and steel for a house extension. Soon her son will get married so a house extension is necessary as well as it will conserve more energy.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and steel for a house extension.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 4º grado, está soltero pero tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos estudian y uno trabaja, actualmente vive junto a su madre.


Desde que dejó la escuela, Manuel trabajaba como jornalero, hace aproximadamente 20 años él iba donde unos amigos que tenían un taller automotriz, y gracias a eso aprendió ese oficio, además le enseñaron a manejar vehículos de transporte de carga (trailers),  es por eso que hoy en día se dedica a manejar esta clase de vehículo y es su fuente de ingresos.

 El crédito sera invertido para comprar una motocicleta, de esta forma se le hará mas fácil trasladarse a su lugar de trabajo.

El sueño de Manuel es mejorar la vivienda de su madre, y le gustaría tener un vehículo propio para trabajar y sobre todo ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 44 years old and has a fourth-grade education. He is single, but is the father of three children, one who works and two who are still in school. Manuel currently lives with his mother. 

Manuel worked as a day laborer after leaving school, but about 20 years ago, he went to work with some friends who had an auto repair shop. This connection gave him the opportunity to learn auto repair. Manuel's friends also taught him to drive large trucks, and Manuel still earns a living as a truck driver today.  

Manuel will use the loan funds to purchase a motorcycle, which make his commute to his workplace easier. 

Manuel's goals include making improvements to his mother's home, having his own vehicle for work, and most importantly, to help his children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so that he can commute to work more easily.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKELEMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Belena, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et de vanne. 
Les femmes du groupe BENKELEMA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente BINTA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter du poison fumé, de l’oignon, du cube Maggi, de la chou fleur et du poivron chez les grossistes à Sanso. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Group Benkelema is composed of married women; they are on average 44 years old with seven children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Belena, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through their families, neighbors, and friends. They retail cereals, condiments, and woven goods. This is the fifth solidarity loan for the women of group Benkelema. To meet the huge demand from their client, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

Binta, the first customer sitting from right to left, is illiterate. She currently sells sauces. She is planning to purchase smoked fish, onions, Maggi bouillon cubes, cauliflowers, and peppers, all from wholesalers in Sanso.

She retails at the market, and takes cash from her mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 40,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en: Repeka is a 59-year-old widow with 10 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Repeka needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, Chinese candy, a large chest freezer and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. Repeka has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, Chinese candy, a large chest freezer and a cooler

loans.name: Erdenetuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenetuya, 46 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been teaching at a high school since 2000. Her husband is dispatcher at a taxicab company. Their two children both go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy vacuum insulated windows, a sofa, drawers and dinner table in order to create a comfortable environment for her family. Her family recently moved to a new apartment, and she wants to make some modifications to her new home.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows, a sofa, drawers and a dinner table for her new apartment home

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Belena, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration et le commerce de divers. 
Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, de l’oignon, du cube Maggi et des condiments chez les grossistes à Massigui. 
La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 48 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Group Benkola is composed of married women; they are on average 44 years old with six children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Belena, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through their families, neighbors, and friends. They work in food service and retail. This is the sixth solidarity loan for the women of group Benkola. To meet the huge demand from their client, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

Fatoumata, the first customer sitting from right to left, is illiterate. She currently manages a restaurant. She plans to purchase rice, onions, Maggi bouillon cubes, and condiments from wholesalers in Massigui.

She retails her dishes from her food stall to a mixed-gender clientele paying cash. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 48,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the restaurant.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic and her husband aspire to become successful and financially stable in the future. She is 30 years old and has only one child. To earn a living, Marivic operates their motorcycle transport while her husband works as a farmer and laborer. Marivic aims to continuously use her motorcycle transport to earn income, but she does not have enough capital. 

For this reason, she wants to avail a loan of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy the needed tire, oil, sprockets, gasoline and other spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle. Through this loan, she believes that she will provide safe transportation to her passengers and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy the needed tire, oil, sprockets, gasoline and other spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Annaliza works hard to support her family.

She has a video gaming machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods and fish vending. Annaliza is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase spare parts and pay for electric bills for her video gaming machine rental business.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay electric bills

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception works hard to support her family. Conception is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Conception requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her business.

Conception has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Conception would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her business

loans.name: Pokobila's Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKOBILA est responsable du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans  et le moins âgé a 04mois. 06 vont à l’école et elle a 08personnes en charge.
Mme est gérante d’une buvette depuis  11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans une cave en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter 06caisses de bière et 04caisses de sucrerie.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte d’épargne pour ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne toujours assurer la scolarité des enfants et agrandir sa buvette.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pokobila is the group leader. She is married and a mother of seven. Her oldest is 24 years old, and her youngest is four months. Six of the children attend school; overall, eight people depend on her.

She has managed a refreshment for eleven years. She gets her supplies from cellars in town. She would like to buy six cases of beer and four boxes of soft drinks.

Mrs. Pokobila wants to open a saving account with her profits. Her ambition is to keep sending her children to school and to expand her refreshment stall.

loans.use: to buy six cases of beer and four cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Catalina is borrowing 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Catalina has been farming vegetables for 15 years and also earns additional income from a computer shop.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Concepcion is 51 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Concepcion has a general store business in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Concepcion has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está divorciada y tiene una hija de 10 años quien estudia 5º grado, vive junto a sus padres y una hermana pero no depende de ellos. 


Yaneth ha trabajado junto a su padre en la agricultura desde los 15 años, ya que sus padres han sido agricultores de toda la vida, actualmente tiene tres años de tener un negocio de tortillas, en el cual trabaja junto a su hermana de 9:00 am a 4:00 pm de lunes a sábado, de esta actividad dependen sus ingresos económicos.

El crédito será utilizado para mejorar la vivienda de esta forma Yaneth y su familia podrán tener una casa en buenas condiciones para habitar.    

Yaneth sueña con tener un terreno propio donde vivir, y así dejárselo como herencia a su hija,  además piensa en trabajar muy duro para que a su hija no le falte nada y tenga todo lo necesario y lo mas importante que se prepare académicamente.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 31 years old and attended school through high school. She is divorced and has a ten year old daughter who is in the fifth grade. She lives together with her parents and one of her sisters, but she is not dependent on them.

Yaneth has worked with her father in farming for the last fifteen years, since her parents have been farmers all of their lives. For the last three years she has had a business selling tortillas, in which she works with her sister from 9am to 4pm Monday through Saturday. She relies on this activity for her income.

The loan will be used to improve the house so that Yaneth and her family will have a home in good condition to live in.

Yaneth dreams of owning her own land to live on and to leave to her daughter as an inheritance. She also plans on working very hard so that her daughter will want for nothing and will have everything she needs, the most important thing being her academic preparation.

loans.use: to improve her house so that Yaneth and her family can have a home in good condition to live in.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
To generate additional income, Jose runs a small variety store within the local community managed by his spouse. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to uplift their status of living. He aims to improve their small retail store, but they have limited capital. 

For this reason, he wants to access financial assistance amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from the Kiva lenders though ASKI to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, soft drinks and vegetables to resell. He is hoping that he will avail this financial assistance to be able for him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, soft drinks and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 60 years old and married with two children.

Demetria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like rice, eggs, chocolate drinks, juice, milk, noodles, etc., to sell.

Demetria has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a computer shop.

Demetria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like rice, eggs, chocolate drinks, juice, milk, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estrella is 34 years old and has five children who are in school.

Estrella has a buying and selling of gadgets business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional gadgets like tablets, cellular phones, etc., to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional gadgets like tablets, cellular phones, etc., to sell

loans.name: Wendpanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme JAENNE est responsable du groupe WENDPANGA. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a24 ans  et le moins âgé a  02ans . 05 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des légumes depuis  20ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de choux et 02caisse de tomates.
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne diversifier son activité en ajoutant  le commerce de pagnes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jaenne is in charge of group Wendpanga. She is married and a mother of seven. Her oldest is 24 years old, and her youngest is two. Five of the children attend school. 

She has sold vegetables for twenty years. She gets her supplies from a neighborhood market. She wants to buy two bags of cabbage and two boxes of tomatoes.

Mrs. Jaenne wants to expand her business with her profits. Her ambition is to diversify her activity and start selling ‘pagnes,’ a local fabric.

loans.use: to buy two bags of cabbage and two boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Tutulu

texts.en: Tutulu is 59 years old and married with six children. She runs a small coconut oil business to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Tutulu needs a loan to buy a large copra oil pressing machine, a new wheelbarrow, new gumboots, overalls, a large outdoor oven and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Tutulu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large copra oil pressing machine, a new wheelbarrow, new gumboots, overalls, a large outdoor oven and gloves

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Leonida has been engaged in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She aims to strengthen her business and make it profitable but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy hog feed, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to improve the business and is hoping that someday she will increase her pigs and income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccines and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Rupi

texts.en: Rupi is 46 years old and married with 8 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 6 years. Rupi needs a loan to buy 2 new display fridges, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes, sugar, flour and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 new display fridges, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes, sugar, flour and salt

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Having insufficient capital, Josie wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI, in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy more stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, noodles and snack foods to resell in the local community. She is 52 years old and has only one child. She is hoping that, someday, she will further improve her business through this financial assistance and give her family a better living.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, noodles and snack foods to resell

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Yuon is a 48-year-old married woman who has three married children and one dependant child. She lives in Svay Chek District of Banteay Meanchey Province. To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for nearly twenty years with an average income of USD 6 a day. 

Yuon wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from an internet cafe.

Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teodula is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Teodula has a sand and gravel sales business in the Philippines. Teodula requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to pay for the sand and gravel and the laborers' salaries.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teodula has been in this business for 11 years. Teodula would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the sand and gravel and the laborers' salaries

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia works hard to support her family. Jovencia has a live-in partner and has a dried fish sales business in the Philippines. Jovencia has been in this business for 3 years now.

Jovencia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jovencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bananas, sweet potatoes, fish and other ingredients needed

loans.name: Ramile

texts.en:
Ramile is 51 years old and a mother of two. She owns and manages a small retail store, while her husband cultivates their farm. 

She aims to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, soaps, vinegar, snack foods and beverages to resell. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to make more improvements in her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, soaps, vinegar, snack foods and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Maricha

texts.en:
Maricha is 52 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maricha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, creamer, etc. 

Maricha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Harlene

texts.en:
Harlene is single and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

Harlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as blouses, pants, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

Harlene has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as blouses, pants, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old and has seven children. Rosa is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Rosa is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

Rosa has been raising goats for 15 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

loans.name: Lucela

texts.en:
Lucela is 60 years old and married with six children.

Lucela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Lucela has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Lucela aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalia is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosalia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell.

Rosalia has been in this business for 20 years. Rosalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia is a 53-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has been in this business for 11 years. Lusia needs a loan to buy a second-hand taxi, new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lusia joined SPBD in 2003 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a second hand taxi, new tyres, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a small retail store within her community to help her husband in gaining income. She is 23 years old and has two kids. To increase her income, she also engages in cooking and selling snack foods. 

She aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, and vegetables, meat and fish to cook and sell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, and vegetables, meat and fish to cook and sell.

loans.name: Rizalinda

texts.en:
Rizalinda is 64 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rizalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as soft drinks, shampoo, sugar, salt, vinegar, canned goods, etc., to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, sugar, salt, vinegar, canned goods, etc. 

Rizalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as soft drinks, shampoo, sugar, salt, vinegar, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Senia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Senia es una joven de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, vive junto a su madre y un hermano.


Desde que terminó de estudiar, Senia consiguió un empleo en un restaurante donde trabaja como mesera desde hace un año, sus turnos de trabajo son de 10:00 am a 9:00 pm y labora cinco días a la semana. Ella tiene que movilizarse 10 km desde su casa a su trabajo, todo el recorrido lo realiza en bus.  De esta actividad dependen todos sus ingresos con los cuales ayuda a su madre.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un terreno, el cual será utilizado para sembrar cultivos de maíz y frijol y será trabajado por su hermano.

El sueño de Senia es tener un negocio de venta de ropa, así tendría mas ingresos para ayudar a su familia y además le gustaría tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Senia is a young woman of 24. She went to school through high school. She is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and a brother.

After she finished her schooling, Senia found a job in a restaurant, where she has worked as a waitress for a year. Her work shifts are from 10:00 am to 9:00 pm, and she works five days a week. She has to travel 10 km from her home to her work. She makes the whole trip by bus. All of her income, with which she helps her mother, depends on this work.

The loan will be used to buy a plot of land, which will be used to plant crops of corn and beans and which will be worked by her brother. 

Senia's dream is to have a business selling clothing. This way she will have more income to help her family, and in addition, she would like to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of land, which will be used to plant crops of corn and beans

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods and fish vending. Teresita is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Magdalena is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Magdalena has a video gaming machine rental business in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to pay for electricity bills.

Magdalena has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for electricity bills

loans.name: Razida

texts.ru: Разиде 35 лет,замужем, мать 4 детей. У Разиды среднее образование, в сфере торговли работает с 2008 года. На местном рынке она арендует контейнер, где продает бижутерию и косметику. Разиде очень нравится ее работа, главной ценностью своей жизни считает свою семью и детей. В среднем ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Разида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара, она планирует приобрести украшения и декоративную косметику, часть средств потратит на ремонт магазина. Доходы от кредита Разида планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее деятельности, так как она мечтает открыть свой собственный магазин.
texts.en: Razida is 35 years old, married and has four children.  Razida has a high school education and has been working in sales since 2008.  She currently rents a stall at the local market, where she sells jewelry and cosmetics.  Razida loves her work and considers the well-being of her family and children to be her primary goal in life.  Her business brings approximately 20,000 som (KGS) each month.  In order to expand her business, Razida turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to increase her assortment of  goods.  She also wants to use that money to make some repairs to the shop.  The profits from her sales, Razida is planning to reinvest into her business, since she has a dream of owing her own shop one day.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and cosmetics for her shop and to make necessary repairs

loans.name: Sii

texts.en: Sii is a 44-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has been in this business for five years. Sii needs a loan to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sii joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.ru: Жамиле 74 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Жамила на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1994 году с покупки 4 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 15 овец и 1 корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Жамила планирует расширить свой бизнес и сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Zhamila is 74 years old, married and has five children.  Zhamila is retired, but she carries on raising and selling livestock to provide income for her family.  She started this business in 1994 with a purchase of 4 sheep.  Thanks to Zhamila's hard work, she now has 15 sheep and one cow.  Her monthly income is approximately 15,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand her business, Zhamila turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional sheep.  Zhamila is planning to use the money in order to expand her business and to make repairs on her house.

loans.use: To purchase sheep so she can expand her livestock business

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз 42 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Кундуз в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2007 году с 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кундуз, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 нетель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, так как она хочет дать своим детям достойное высшее образование.
texts.en: Kunduz is 42 years old, married and has three children.  To provide income for her family, Kunduz raises livestock, a business that she started in 2007 with 7,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Kunduz currently has four milk cows, one horse and one heifer.  In order to expand her business, Kunduz turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase another heifer.  Profits from her business Kunduz is planning to reinvest into her business and put some aside for her children's university education.

loans.use: To purchase a heifer

loans.name: Carmen Amabel

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 50 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado ya que su padre falleció y se vio en la necesidad de  empezar a trabajar para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, Carmen nunca se casó y no tiene hijos. 


Carmen es una mujer luchadora, con muchos deseos de superarse, desde que abandonó la escuela inició a trabajar en una tortillería a la edad de 15 años, ahí trabajo diez años, luego su madre logró poner una pequeña tienda en su casa, desgraciadamente falleció al poco tiempo y fue así como Carmen continuó con el pequeño negocio que su madre con mucho sacrificio y dedicación pudo tener. Han pasado 21 años desde que su madre falleció y el negocio aún lo sigue manteniendo, de la tienda dependen sus ingresos para lograr cubrir los gastos del hogar.


Con el préstamo Carmen podrá invertir nuevamente en la tienda, así podrá tener su fuente de ingresos y a la vez el negocio que es un recuerdo que tiene de la persona mas especial, seguirá presente por mucho tiempo al servicio de los clientes. De esta forma se ayudara a que Carmen pueda crecer en el negocio.

Gracias al crédito Carmen logrará cumplir uno de sus sueños, el cual es crecer el negocio, además de esto siempre quiso tener una venta de ropa, y sabe que si todo sale como la ha planificado, podrá ver cumplida  todos estas metas que tiene.
texts.en:
Carmen, 50, went to school through sixth grade, but then her father died so she had to start working to help her mother with household expenses. Carmen never married and has no children.

Carmen is a hard-working woman with a desire to succeed. When she left school, she started working in a tortilla shop at the age of 15. She worked there for 15 years and then her mother was able to open a small store from home. Unfortunately, she passed away shortly after so this is how Carmen came to continue the small business that her mother started with much sacrifice and dedication. Now, 21 years have passed since her mother's passing and the business is still going. She depends on the income to pay household expenses.

With this loan, Carmen will invest in her store again so she will have a source of income and also a business that is a memory of the most special person. She will continue like this for a long time to serve her customers. This will help Carmen grow her business.

Thanks to this loan, Carmen will fulfill one of her dreams, which is to grow her business. Also, she always wanted to have a clothing store, and she knows that if everything goes as planned, she will be able to fulfill all of her goals.

loans.use: to invest in her store and earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her cultivation of coffee in the new season.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Victorina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Victorina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a widowed woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilma is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Wilma has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Wilma has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items of clothing to increase her stock.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
La necesidad de  seguir adelante en la vida ha llevado a Manuel a aprender algunos oficios.  A través de los años se ha dedicado a vender medicina y poner sueros a los enfermos.  

Además de que la gente lo busca para sus medicinas, existen otras personas que lo buscan para que les haga alguna costura ya que también Manuel es costurero.

Se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para ampliar su negocio de venta de medicina que es su servicio para las personas.  Además que le gustaría seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The need to move forward in life has led Manuel to learn some trades. Over the years, he has made a living selling medicine and giving serums to the sick.

In addition to the people who come to him for his medicines, other people seek him out for sewing, since Manuel is also a tailor.

He has found it necessary to request a loan in order to expand his medicine selling business which is his service for the people. In addition, he would like to continue supporting his children.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: María Mariana

texts.es:
María es una señora de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta tercer grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios por problemas económicos y se dedico a ayudarle a su mamá en los que haceres del hogar, es una mujer casada y madre de 9 hijos de 36, 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 23, 19 y 17 de los cuales solo dos están estudiando son los que dependen de ella, los demás ya están casados y tienen su propio hogar; su esposo se dedica a la agricultura mientras que María se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante desde hace un año, trabajo que lo aprendió por la necesidad y la situación económica en que vivía, trabaja en el horario de 8:00 am a 12:00 del mediodía.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para surtir mas la venta de ropa, así podrá mostrar mas variedad por lo tanto va a satisfacer a los clientes y así tendrá más ingresos y con ello podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.

El sueño de María es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales, mejorar el negocio de ropa y ampliar más su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora María is 53 years old, and she is a housewife. She studied until the third grade. She was unable to continue her studies because of financial problems, and she devoted herself to helping her mother with the household duties.  She is married with 9 children, ages 36, 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 23, 19, and 17. Only two of them are studying, and they are the ones who depend upon her. The others are already married and have their own homes. 

Her husband works in agriculture, while María has been selling clothing on foot for a year, work that she learned out of necessity and her economic situation.  She works from 8:00 A.M. until 12 P.M. She is requesting a loan from CrediCampo in order to stock more clothing to sell. In this way, she will be able to present a greater variety of clothing to satisfy her customers. Thus, she will have more income with which she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

María’s dreams are that her children may become professionals, that she can improve her clothing sales business, and expand her house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in order to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación.

Es el caso de Francisco  de 24 años quien vive en Sololá  con sus tres hijos.  Quien se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra como campesino su único oficio por muchos años.

Sin embargo no tiene un terreno propio para cultivar y es la razón por la que él ha solicitado un préstamo porque su sueño es tener sus propios terrenos y heredárselos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The land is a blessing for those who enjoy working it and caring for it. The people who dedicate themselves for years or even their whole lives to the land are worthy of our admiration. Without the toil of countrymen and women the land will not bear fruit for the sustenance of all. 

24-year old Francisco is such a person. He lives in Sololá with his three children. He has dedicated many years to working the land. However, he doesn't have land of his own on which to grow crops so he is seeking a loan in order to fulfill his dream of owning land that can be passed on to his children.

loans.use: Buy land on which to grow crops

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos es un señor de 34 años de edad, es jornalero, estudió hasta noveno grado por problemas económicos no continuo sus estudios, esta acompañado y es padre de tres hijos de 16, 14 y 13 años de edad, los cuales se encuentran estudiando; por lo tanto dependen de él su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, su compañera de vida se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar mientras que Carlos se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz desde hace 20 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre quien toda su vida se dedico a eso, Carlos para trasladarse a su lugar de trabajo viaja un kilómetro y medio en bicicleta trabajando en el horario de 5:00 am a 12:00 del mediodía.

El préstamo que Carlos esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras, con las cuales podrá tener un mayor ingreso y dará una mejor alimentación a sus tres hijos y su compañera de vida.

El sueño de Carlos es que sus tres hijos se preparen y sean unos profesionales, tener un negocio propio y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is 34 years old and a laborer. He has a grade 9 education but couldn't continue because of financial difficulties. He is married and has three children aged 16, 14, and 13, all of whom attend school. His children and his wife are dependent on him. Carlos's wife looks after the household while he tends his maize crop. He's grown maize for twenty years, work that he learned from his father who grew maize his whole life. To get to his fields Carlos bikes about 1.5 km and works there from 5am to midday.

With the loan money that he is seeking from CREDICAMPO, Carlos plans to buy two cows so that he can earn more money and provide better food for his family. His dreams are to see his children well-educated and with good jobs, to have his own business, and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy two cows so that he can earn more money and provide better food for his family

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, no estudio por falta de recursos económicos, es ama de casa, esta viuda y es madre de 3 hijos de 35, 33 y 32 años de edad, los cuales ya están casados; María vive sola.

María se dedica a vender helados de diferentes sabores y a la siembra de maíz desde hace tres años, trabajo que lo aprendió por sus propios medios y por la necesidad en que vivía, ella trabaja en el horario de 8:00 am a 5:00 pm todos los días. El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar de insumos agrícolas como veneno y abono, así podrá mejorar su cultivo de maíz, donde podrá tener un ingreso mas para su bienestar.

María sueña con tener 18 animales, mejorar su vivienda y tener un negocio (tienda).
texts.en:
Maria, who is 54 years old, did not go to school due to the lack of economic resources. She is a housewife. She is a widow and is the mother of three children, ages 35, 33, and 32, who are already married. Maria lives alone.

For three years, Maria has been selling ice cream of various flavors and planting corn. She learned this work on her own and out of the necessity in which she was living. She works on a schedule from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm every day. The loan that she is applying for from the institution is to buy agricultural supplies such as poison and compost. Thus she will be able to improve her corn crop, where she will have another income for her well-being.

Maria dreams of having 18 animals, improving her house, and having a business (store).

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as poison and compost; thus she will be able to improve her planting of corn, where she will be able to have another income for her well-being.

loans.name: Henry Jair

texts.es:
Henry es un joven de 26 años de edad, es pescador artesanal, estudió hasta octavo grado porque no pudo continuar sus estudios, esta acompañado y es padre de una pequeña niña de 4 años de edad, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios del hogar, mientras que Henry se dedica a la crianza de cerdos de engorde desde hace un año trabajo que lo aprendió de su madre, también se dedica a la pesca artesanal; para llegar a su trabajo camina un kilometro, trabaja en el horario de 1:00 pm a 6:00 pm.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar mas cerdos, así podrá ampliar su crianza para llegar a tener un poco mas de ingresos con los cuales podrá darle a su esposa y su hija una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Henry es ampliar más su negocio de crianza de cerdos y poder pagar el crédito que esta solicitando sin ninguna inconveniente.
texts.en:
Henry is a young man of 26. He is a traditional fisherman. He went to school through eighth grade because he was not able to continue his studies. He is married and is the father of a little girl of 4. His life companion does the household tasks, while Henry has been raising pigs for a year, work that he learned from he mother. He also works as a traditional fisherman. To arrive at his work, he walks a kilometer. He works on a schedule from 1:00 pm to 6:00 pm.

The loan that he is applying for at the institution is to buy more pigs. Thus he will be able to expand his pig-raising business to have a little more income with which he will be able to give his wife and his daughter a better quality of life.

Henry's dream is to expand his pig-raising business more and to be able to pay off the loan that he is applying for without any problem.

loans.use: to buy more pigs. Thus he will be able to expand his pig-raising business and have a little more income with which he will be able to give his wife and daughter a better quality of life.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a married woman with two children from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers at a secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide where she guides and supports young students. When she is not at the local school, Charity runs a poultry business that produces 100 broiler birds every 6 weeks, and then she sells the chickens to local residents. Charity started the business in 2013 when her family was facing financial difficulties. Poultry production is a thriving business in her community, and Charity would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. Charity will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable her to cater to her children’s needs as well as pay school fees for her two siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María de 34 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta tercer grado, por problemas económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios, decidió acompañarse y procreo 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando y dependen de ella. Ahora en día María se separo con su compañero de vida, por lo tanto solo vive con sus 4 hijos. María se dedica a atender una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa, también los fines de semana ella hace comida típica para vender, trabajo que lo aprendió de una amiga y por la necesidad económica en que vivía.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO es para surtir mas su tienda comprando frijoles, arroz, galletas, churros, dulces, jabón, lejía, rinso etc., así podrá satisfacer mas las necesidades de los clientes y obtener un mejor ingreso con el que mejorara su calidad de vida.

María sueña con darles estudios a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales, ampliar mas su tienda y poder pagar el crédito solicitado en la institución sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
María is a 34 year old housewife who studied up to Grade 3 but for economic reasons could not continue her studies. She entered a relationship and has 4 children from it. They are studying and dependent on her. Today María is separated from her life companion and therefore lives alone with her 4 children. María works caring for her small store that she has in her house. She also makes traditional food to sell on the week-ends, something she learned from a friend and from the economic necessities she lives with.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to stock her store buying beans, rice, biscuits, churros, sweets, soap, bleach and detergent. She can satisfy her customer's needs better and generate more income which would improve her quality of living. María dreams of providing education so her children can become professionals. expanding her store and paying off the loan she is requesting from the institution with no problem.

loans.use: to stock her store buying beans, rice, biscuits, churros, sweets, soap, bleach, detergent etc.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
El banano se ha convertido en una de las frutas favoritas de la población de Sololá, especialmente en el tiempo de verano. Es desgustado de diferentes maneras.

Pascuala de 34 años y soltera, se dedica precisamente a la venta de esta fruta en todo tiempo. También tiene almacigo de café, productos que le ayudan a sostenerse económicamente a ella y a su familia que siempre le ha apoyado.

Ha solicitado un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y así aumentar sus ingresos, éste negocio le ha ayudado en gran manera a solventar sus necesidades.
texts.en:
The banana has become one of the favorite fruits of the people of Sololá, especially in the summer. It is enjoyed in different ways.

Pascuala, who is 34 and single, works specifically in the sale of this fruit at all times. She also has a seedling nursery for coffee plants, products that help her to economically sustain herself and her family, whom she has always helped.

She has applied for a loan to expand her business and thus increase her income. This business has helped her in a great way to pay for her necessities.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: José Rufino

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, sus padres le enseñaron la agricultura y ganadería oficio que practica desde hace 24 años, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa  lo apoya en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana, solo tiene un hijo.


 José se dedica a la agricultura y trabaja durante la mañana, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen y así vender la leche en los alrededores.


	Él necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca  que le servirá en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Sus planes son seguir adelante con la venta de elche y comprar un terreno en el cual puedan permanecer sus vacas.
texts.en: José is 41 years old. His parents taught him agriculture and livestock raising, occupations he has practiced for 24 years. He studied up to Grade 6. He is married and his wife helps him with his agricultural work during the morning. He has one son. José does his farming and works during the morning and his wife does the housework, milks the cows they have and sells the milk in the neighborhood. José needs the loan to buy a cow that in the future will increase his milk production for sale and generate additional income for his family. His plans are to continue going ahead with his sale of milk and buy some land where he can keep his cows.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase his milk production.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad, oficio que le enseñó su madre y que ella realiza desde hace  varios años,  está casada y estudio hasta noveno grado.
         
Maria  se dedica al comercio de arroz, frijol, maíz,etc; la cuales vende en los alrededores de su residencia y su esposo trabaja en proyectos de construcción, ambos se ayudan para llevar el sustento a su familia.

Ella necesita el crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se filtra el agua lo que le daña sus muebles y mercadería y necesita comprar los materiales como: lámina zincalum, polines, cemento, etc 

María planea en un futuro poder  comprar un vehículo para salir a los cantones a comprar mas granos ya que los consiguen mas baratos y con ayuda de CrediCampo y su familia espera lograrlo.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. She makes a living selling staple goods, which she has been doing for several years and it's a trade that her mother taught her. She is married and studied up until the 9th grade.

Maria sells rice, beans, corn, etc., which she sells in the area near her home. Her husband works on construction projects. Both of them help each other provide for their family.

María needs a loan to repair the roof of her house since currently water is leaking, which is damaging her furniture and her products. She needs to buy materials such as metal sheets, purlins, cement, etc.

In the future, María plans to be able to buy a vehicle to go out to the cantons to buy more grains since she can get them cheaper there. With the help of CrediCampo and her family, she hopes to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy materials such as metal sheets, purlins, cement, etc., to repair the roof of her house since currently water is leaking, which is damaging her furniture and her products.

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es: Don Guillermo, un humilde señor que se mantiene gracias a los servicios que brinda de acarreo con su camioneta en uno de los mercados de Managua, quien como planes futuros tiene el poner un pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos de motos en su casa para aumentar sus ingresos, por mientras esto se hace realidad está luchando con su labor actual, por el momento desea continuar la mejora de su vivienda que tiene las puertas en mal estado, el cual es una pieza clave para mantener la seguridad de la vivienda por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar dos puertas de madera e instalarla.
texts.en: Guillermo is a humble man who makes a living thanks to the services he offers transporting things with his truck in one of Managua's markets.
