He has a plan to open a small business selling motorcycle spare parts from his house to increase his income. Until this becomes a reality he is continuing with his present labor. For the moment he wants to continue to make improvements on his house. The doors are in bad shape and they are a key piece in maintaining the security of the house. So he is requesting a loan to buy two wooden doors and install them.

loans.use: to buy two doors.

loans.name: Luis Mariano

texts.es:
Luis tiene 57 años de edad, solo estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y tiene 2 hijos.
 
 Luis  se dedica a la agricultura, para llegar a la parcelas camina 800 mts  y trabaja durante la mañana, mientras su esposa ordeña y se dedica a  vender la leche, en el transcurso de la tarde él cuida los animales en los potreros que alquila, además cuida animales de otras personas y le pagan por ello.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera y obtener mas leche para la venta y así lograr más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.


Sus planes son comprar un terreno donde tener los animales ya que alquila actualmente y le sale mas caro.
texts.en:
Luis is 57 years old. He only went to school through 9th grade. He is married and has 2 children.

Luis works in agriculture. To arrive at his plots of land, he walks 800 meters. He works during the morning, while his wife does the milking and sells the milk. During the afternoon he cares for the animals in the pastures that he rents. In addition, he cares for other people's animals, and they pay him for this.

He needs the loan to buy a milk cow and obtain more milk to sell and thus realize more income for the sustenance of his family.

His plans are to buy a plot of land where he can have his animals, since he is now renting and it is more expensive for him.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and obtain more milk to sell and thus realize more income for the sustenance of his family.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
A pesar de la era tecnológica en que vivimos, Sololá no ha perdido su idiosincrasia donde parte de ella es la agricultura donde nuevas generaciones todavía se dedican con esmero.

Es el caso de Pedro un agricultor de 35 años con dos hijos.  El se ha dedicado a cultivar café y a la producción de banano, actividades agrícolas fuente de ingresos para su familia.

El crédito que Pedro ha solicitado quiere utilizarlo para mejorar sus cosechas y así darle un futuro mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In spite of the technological era in which we live, Sololá has not lost its character, part of which is agricultural, where new generations still work with conscientiousness.

This is the case with Pedro, a farmer of 35 with two children. He raises coffee and produces bananas, agricultural work that is the source of income for his family.

Pedro wants to use the loan that he has applied for to improve his harvests and thus give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Gulzhamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал 44 года, вдова, мать 4 детей, все дети помогают по хозяйству. Образование у Гулжамал среднее, она работает в школе учителем, так же дополнительно с 1988 года занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, она очень общительная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве Гулжамал есть 4 дойные коровы с телятами, экологически чистое молоко и молочная продукция пользуются большим спросом среди местных жителей, которым она и реализует молоко. Также Гулжамал вместе со своими детьми выращивает на 0,80 ГА собственной земли хлопок, который реализует оптовым покупателям. Совокупный доход семьи составляет около 20,000 (KGS) в месяц. Количество покупателей растет с каждым днем, поэтому Гулжамал решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и двух дойных коров. На прибыль от кредита планирует построить большой сарай для скота и начать строительство дома для сына.
texts.en: Gulzhamal is 44 and a widow with four children who all help around the house. She has a high school education and works as a schoolteacher. Since 1988, she has also worked in agriculture, specifically growing crops and animal husbandry. She is a very kind and responsible woman, very social and hardworking. She has four milking cows with calves, and her fresh milk and dairy products are in great demand among local residents to whom she sells them. Gulzhamal and her children also grow cotton on 0.8 hectares of their own land and sell it to wholesale buyers. Her total family income is about 20,000 KGS a month. Her customer base increases every day and therefore Gulzhamal has decided to develop her business. She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows. She plans to build a big barn with profits from the loan and to start building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to increase her cotton harvest and to purchase dairy cows in order to increase revenue from milk sales

loans.name: Ramón Alfredo

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 27 años de edad, es una persona casada que aprendió la agricultura por sus padres y  convive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, estudió hasta educación media.

Ramón se dedica  a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace varios años, trabaja en la parcelas durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además en la tarde Ramón trabaja como vigilante en una agroservicio para obtener ingresos adicionales.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos (semilla, abono, veneno,etc.) que necesita para poder sembrar y obtener una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.

Sus planes son que con los ingresos que obtiene de su la cosecha podrá  construirle a su familia una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Ramon is 27 years old, he is a married person who learnt farming from his parents. He lives with his wife and 2 children. He studied up to middle school.

Ramon has worked in agriculture for many years. He works in the fields in the morning and his wife takes care of the household chores. Furthermore, in the afternoons Ramon works as a security guard at an farming service to obtain additional income.

He needs this loan to buy supplies (seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc) he needs to be able to plant and get a good harvest to sustain his family.

His plans are to get a good harvest with the supplies he obtains to be able to build a decent dwelling for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies (seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc) to get a good harvest to sustain his family.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Los pueblos son privilegiados cuando hay manos femeninas detrás de cualquier producción, los esposos se sienten muy apoyados por esposas así, que se dedican además de los quehaceres domésticos también se dedican a cultivar la tierra.

María de 33 años con sus tres hijos y esposo, se dedica precisamente al cultivo de café y banano donde apoya a su esposo para los ingresos de su familia.

Pero ella aspira a más y con el préstamo que ha solicitado desea comprar terrenos para dejárselos a sus hijos para que ellos puedan realizar sus vidas cuando sean adultos.
texts.en:
People are privileged when there are feminine hands behind any production. In this way, the husbands feel very much supported by their wives, who in addition to the domestics duties also work in cultivating the land.

Maria, who is 33 years old and has three children and a husband, works particularly in raising coffee and bananas, where she helps her husband with the family income.

But she aspires to more, and with the loan that she has applied for, she wants to buy land to leave to her children so that they can carry out their lives when they are adults.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: El Eucalipto Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Eucalipto está integrado por tres socios que compran y venden productos con el fin de obtener un margen de ganancias y colaborar en sus hogares. El coordinador es el joven Jonathan de 21 años de edad, acompañado, se dedica a la compra y venta de leña y diferentes cosechas, requiere el préstamo para compra fletes de leñas. Con el crédito anterior compro motosierra y se ha propuesto la compra de maquinaria para la mejora del negocio. Las otras socias son la señora Marlene de 50 años de edad, que vende tamales en el mercado del municipio y la señora Keylin 19 años de edad, quien se dedica a vender legumbres desde hace cuatro años en el mercado más populoso de la capital.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Eucalipto is made up of three members who buy and sell products with the goal of obtaining a margin of earnings and contributing to their households. The coordinator is the young Jonathan, who is 21 years old. He is married. He buys and sells firewood and various crops. He needs the loan to buy loads of firewood. With the past loan, he bought a chainsaw and has proposed the purchase of machinery to improve the business.

The other members are Señora Marlene, who is 50 and sells tamales in the municipal market, and Señora Keylin, who is 19 and has been selling vegetables for four years in the most populous market of the capital.

loans.use: to buy loads of firewood

loans.name: Clarah

texts.en:
Clarah is a 28-year-old entrepreneur and mother from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. For the past year she has been successfully operating a small shop selling sugar, flour, cooking oil and stationery.

As a participant in Camfed’s program for young women borrowers (see below), Clarah is a volunteer Learner Guide. She teaches life skills at the local secondary school and helps clean the facility as well.

Clarah is applying for a 500 USD loan through Camfed to make bulk purchases of sugar, flour, cooking oil, boxes of matches and candles to sell in her shop. With the profits she hopes to earn, she will be able to more adequately provide for her family.

As her business expands and profits grow, Clarah’s goal is to establish a chain of small shops around the community. More shops would help her fellow villagers by reducing the distance they have to travel to buy groceries.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Primera Vez Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas en su vida laborar, es coordinado por la señora Juana de 43 años de edad, acompañada, y madre de 3 hijos, quienes la han motivado para su superación brindándole el apoyo de seguir adelante con  los planes que se proponga; su negocio es compra de cosechas y luego comercializarlas en el mercado de la municipalidad, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace quince años, entre los diferentes productos que ella ofrece están los tomates, mangos, mandarinas, nancites y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosechas de mamones y nancite, con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio y poder  satisfacer la demanda que tiene de este producto. Con los créditos anteriores invirtió productos que la población estaba demandando por lo que las ganancias fueron mayor y le permitió reinvertir en su negocio y la comprar artículos personales. Otra socia es la señora Maria del Socorro que tiene la edad de 44 años, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad y por último la señora Mercedes con 33 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The communal bank comprises three successful members in their work life. It is coordinated by Juana who is 43 years old, she has a partner and is the mother of three children who have motivated her to get ahead, offering the support to get ahead with the plans she proposes:

Her business is buying and then selling harvest in the municipal market. She has been in this business for fifteen years. The different products she sells include tomatoes, mangos, mandarins, nance fruit [a small yellow fruit from the acerola family]. The loan she is requesting is to purchase harvests of lychee and nance fruit, with the objective of making her business grow and being able to satisfy the demand for this product. 

With the previous loans she invested in products which the townspeople was asking for so that her earnings were greater and this allowed her to reinvest in her business and buy personal items.

The other member is Maria del Socorro who is 44 years old, she works selling fruit in the municipal market and the last members is Mercedes who is 33 years old and works selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy harvests of lychees and nance fruit.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is an entrepreneur and married mother from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is in the poultry business and produces about 100 broiler birds every six weeks. Ivy started her business to increase finances for her family, and she was pleased to discover that it was easy to set up and manage.

As a participant in Camfed’s program for young women borrowers (see below), Ivy is a volunteer Learner Guide. As part of this program she teaches leadership skills to young students.

Ivy is applying for a 500 USD loan through Camfed because she sees potential in her business. She would like to buy more broiler chicks and feed to increase production and increase her sales volume. In this way Ivy will be able to better provide for her family and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To buy more broiler chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 62 years old and a married woman. She has seven married children and one child who is still a dependent. Her family lives in Bakan District of Pursat Province.

To earn a living, Mao and her husband farm rice, which is the sole source of their income. They have done so for almost forty years and earn an average of 6 USD a day.

As there is no latrine in her house, Mao wants to improve life for her family by having one. Therefore, she is borrowing a 2,000,000 KHR loan through HKL to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen inevitable environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, as it has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a 34-year-old married woman and has two children, who are both in school.

Cherry is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cherry has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Diona

texts.en:
Ronald Rey is 21 years old and is the first of the four children in his family. His mother Diona, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her  business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Ronald Rey is studying for his Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the 4th year of this 4-year course.

Diona, Ronald Rey's mother, is borrowing PHP 7500 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Ronald Rey plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's college tuition fees

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 33 years old and married. Edlyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Edlyn runs a genaral store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like cereals, chocolate drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, bread, etc. to sell.

Edlyn has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Edlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cereals, chocolate drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, bread, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 59 years old and married with two children. 

Grace is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Las vocaciones son necesarias para toda empresa o profesión, sin ellas éstas opacan los aspectos que son innatos y necesarios en los seres humanos.

Manuel se ha dedicado a una de las profesiones más solemnes que existen en toda sociedad como lo es la docencia.  Es maestro en Sololá desde hace más de ocho años, pero lo ha sentido desde pequeño.  Sus alumnos lo esperan siempre cada mañana para que Manuel le imparta el saber de la vida.

También la docencia le ha provisto una fuente económica para el sustento de su familia compuesta de 4 hijos.  Su sueño es poder dejar un terreno para sus hijos como herencia, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo.  Además de darles estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
A vocation is necessary for all businesses or professions, without them one is overshadowed by the issues which are innate and necessary for humans.

Manuel has worked in one of the most dignified professions that exists in all of society which is teaching. He has been a teacher in Sololá for more than eight years, but he had wanted to do this since he was young. His pupils always wait for him every morning so that Manuel can impart the knowledge of life to them.

Teaching has also been a source of income to sustain his family made up of four children. His dream is to be able to leave a plot of land to his children as an inheritance, which is the reason he is requesting a loan. Furthermore he wants his children to get an education.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Greg is 21 years old and is the third of the six children in the family. His mother Helen, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Greg is studying for his Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the fourth of this four-year course.

Helen, Greg's mother, is borrowing PHP 7350 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year of 2014-15.

Greg plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's college tuition fees

loans.name: Ma. Mierna

texts.en:
Ma. Mierna is a 40-year-old married woman with three children; two children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Mierna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Ma. Mierna requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, Ma. Mierna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca Nieve Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Blanca Nieve está conformado por cuatro señoras laboriosas con ánimo de salir adelante, en donde la coordinadora es la señora Tania de 23 años de edad, acompañada, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a los pobladores de la comunidad desde hace un  año y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de inventario de cosméticos  tales como brillos, maquillaje, sombras, lápiz y de cejas, pinturas labiales, body corporales, perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, etc., con el fin de obtener un apoyo económico al satisfacer las necesidades de estas personas. Las otras socias son la señora Yissenia de 38 anos de edad, su negocio gira entorno a una pulpería desde hace seis años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, pan, etc., la señora Maribel de 37 años de edad,  se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas desde hace diez años en su domicilio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, cal, leña, bolsa,  y finalmente la señora Erlis de 37 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y materiales de construcción desde hace treinta años en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Blanca Nieve is comprised of four hardworking ladies who have the spirit to get ahead.The coordinator is Tania of 23 years old, she has a partner and has worked selling cosmetics to the inhabitants of the community for a year. The loan she is requesting is to purchase inventory such as glitter, makeup, eyeshadow, eyebrow pencil, lipstick, body creams, perfumes for women and men, etc. with the aim of getting the economic support to satisfy the needs of these people.

The other members are Yissenia of 38 years old, her business revolves around a grocery store which she has had for six years and the loan she requests is for purchasing rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, etc; Maribel of 37 years old, she has worked making and selling tortillas for ten years from home, the loan she requests is to buy bushels of corn, lime, firewood and bags and finally; Erlis is 37 years old and has worked selling cosmetics and construction materials for thirty years in her community.

loans.use: to buy glitter, makeup, eyeshadow, eyebrow pencil, lipstick, body creams, perfumes for women and men, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Pacita earns additional income from pig fattening.

Pacita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc., for her business. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc., for her business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is widowed. She was born in 1955. Dilorom has been working for more than 23 years in a state organization. She is a higher educated woman. Dilorom lives with her son and daughter-in-law. Dilorom lives near her office, and she walks there every day. Dilorom is going to change the doors and windows of her house. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni to buy doors and windows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy doors and windows

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 52 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades, su familia está formada por dos hijos y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades de la agricultura.

Alfonso se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ordeñar y luego irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen.

 
Él necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. que necesita para la siembra,  cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha. 

Sus sueños en un futuro son tener mas ganado de ordeño con ayuda de otro crédito, con la ayuda de su familia y de las ganancias obtenidas darles un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 52 years old. He is a farmer and rancher. He grew up with his parents who taught him these trades. His family is formed of two children and his wife who help him with the farm work.

Alfonso gets up at 4:30 am to get ready and then go to the spots where he works during the morning with his children. His wife tends to domestic things and takes care of the cows they have.

He needs this loan to purchase farming supplies such as poison, seeds, compost, etc. that he needs for planting. He has several years of requisite experience in getting a good harvest.

His dreams for the future are to have more dairy cows through another loan, and with the help of his family and earned income to give them (his family) a better future.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as poison, seeds, compost, etc. that he needs for planting.

loans.name: Los Trejos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario los Trejos está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, la coordinadora del grupo es la señora Dania, acompañada, y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en las calles de la comunidad, además vende comida (desayuno y almuerzos) en su domicilio, solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, plátano maduro, plátano verde, pastas, cajillas de huevo, café, queso, remolacha, repollo, etc., además invertirá en cosméticos como perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, vanidades, cremas corporales, body corporales, etc., con el objetivo de ofrecer más variedad de productos a su clientela y así aumentar su clientela, y por ende obtener mayores ganancias. Las otras socias son  la señora Amalia de 46 años de edad, quien es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cuatro años y la señora Maritza que se dedica a la venta de productos varios tales como gaseosas, refrescos y ropa en su domicilio desde hace dos años.
texts.en: The Los Trejos group is formed of three enterprising women. The group coordinator is Dania. She is married. She sells cosmetics in the streets of her community. She also sells meals (breakfast and lunch) from her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, ripe plantains, green plantains, pasta, cartons of eggs, coffee, cheese, beets, cabbage, etc. She will also invest in cosmetics such as women's perfume, men's cologne, compacts, body creams, etc. The goal is to offer more product variety to her customers, grow her clientele, and ultimately earn better revenue. The other members are Amalia, 46 years old, who has been a grocery store owner for four years, and Maritza who has been selling a variety of products such as soft drinks, other beverages, and clothes from her home for two years.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, ripe plantains, green plantains, pasta, cartons of eggs, coffee, cheese, beets, cabbage, etc., as well as cosmetics.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y sus hijas le ayudan en lo necesario.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja en fontanería en la bomba de agua de la comunidad para obtener un ingreso adicional.

 
	Él solicita este préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas como semilla, veneno, abono, etc. para sembrar una parcela que espera le produzca una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia. 
.

sus sueños en un futuro sembrar jicama y espera lograrlo con la ayuda de otro crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old. He is married, and his daughters help him as needed.

Carlos farms. He gets up at 4:30 am to go to work during the morning in the field that he rents. During the rest of the day, he works in plumbing at the community water pump to earn additional income.

He is requesting this loan to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, poison, compost, etc. to sow a field that he hopes will produce for him a good harvest to support his family.

His dreams for the future are to plant jicama, and he hopes to do this with the help of another loan.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, poison, compost, etc. to sow a field.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village in the Khobi district with her husband, five-year-old son, and pensioner parents-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have hens and a plot of agricultural land where nut trees, maize and haricot are grown. Irine and her husband work hard to ensure a good harvest, and they sell the harvested products in local markets. 

Irine decided to start a husbandry business along with their agricultural activities. The start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase a milking cow. Once the cow is purchased, Irine will start producing dairy products to use for her family as well as to sell locally. This will increase their income and she will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
El orden, la disciplina, la limpieza son valores familiares que nunca deben dejarse de practicar y son factores que influyen en la vida adulta aún cuando el ser humano se convierte en un profesional.

Reyna se dedica a éste oficio, profesión, vocación.  Ella con 50 años de edad y cinco hijos, no tuvo oportunidades para obtener un grado académico.  Decidió entonces criar a sus hijos como ama de casa.

Ella solicita una préstamo para construir una casa, cómoda y en el futuro poder instalar un negocio para su sustento familiar y continuar la vida.
texts.en:
Order, discipline, and cleanliness are family values that you should never stop practicing. They are factors that influence your adult life even when a human being becomes a professional.

Reyna works in this trade, profession, vocation. She, at 50 years old, with five children, did not have opportunities to get a grade school education. She decided, then, to raise her children as a housewife.

She is requesting a loan to build a comfortable house. In the future she will be able to start a business to support her family and continue life.

loans.use: to construct her own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase supply of meat to butcheries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase better quality clothes in larger amounts so as to increase sales.

loans.name: La Vista Del Angel Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario La vista del Ángel quien está conformado por tres señoras trabajadoras y responsables. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Andrea de 40 anos de edad, soltera, quien se dedica a la venta de cajetas y diferentes tipos de ropa de manera ambulante y en su domicilio desde hace nueve años; solicita el crédito para la inversión en mercadería de ropa como es camisetas, jean para damas, jean para caballeros, licras, talladores, vestidos para niñas, trajes para niños, etc., este es el segundo ciclo que la institución le brinda financiamiento para su negocio y con el crédito anterior la socia obtuvo mayores ganancias lo que le permitió reinvertir en los productos que más demanda tiene por parte de la población. Las otras socias son las señoras, Mercedes y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos en las calles de su comunidad. La otra socia es la señora Aura de 58 años de edad, ella se dedica a destazar cerdos y luego realizar derivados de el como es nacatamales, chicharrón, fritos, lo que le ha permitido obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
The La Vista del Angel (Vision of the Angel) group is formed of three hardworking and responsible women. The coordinator of the group is Maria Andrea, 40 years old, single.  She sells caramels and different kinds of clothing in a traveling manner and from her home. She has been doing this for nine years. She is requesting the loan to invest in clothing merchandise such as shirts, women's jeans, men's jeans, lycra, camisoles, dresses for girls, suits for boys, etc.

This is the second loan cycle with this institution for her business, and with the previous loan, the member earned better revenue. This allowed her to reinvest in the products with highest demand from the population.

The other members are Mercedes, and she sells clothes and cosmetics in the streets of her community. The other member is Aura, 58 years old. She butchers pigs and then makes products from them such as nactamales (like tamales), pork rinds, and fried things. This has allowed her to get better profit margins.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise such as shirts, women's jeans, men's jeans, children's outfits, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
To generate income, Fely has been engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within their village. She aims to continue the business and make it profitable in order to gain a higher income. 

Fely plans to cook and sell more snack recipes but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a financial assistance of PHP 5,000 to buy pork, seasonings, vinegar, fish balls, hot dogs, flour, sugar and cooking oil, which she needs to cook and sell. She believes that this financial assistance will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pork, seasonings, vinegar, fish balls, hot dogs, flour, sugar and cooking oil

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying more supplies to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 26 years old and married with one child. She has been in the agricultural business for the past three years, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Roselyn has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Roselyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn, aged 36, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Roselyn has been in this business for three years. 

Roselyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is a 24-year-old, married businesswoman from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She spends her time volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide by teaching life skills to secondary school students. She also runs a poultry business, producing 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started her business to become financially independent, and she hopes to see other young women in her community prosper like she has.

With a Kiva loan, Memory will purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She intends to become a supplier to major supermarkets one day.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy llamas, and with the profits, feed her six children.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira comes from Tajikistan. She is the sole breadwinner for her daughter and herself because she is divorced. Shoira lives with her daughter and her parents. She graduated from medical college 22 years ago and, since then, has worked in a local hospital as a nurse in the department of children's surgery. 

Shoira is going to repair the house in which they live as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a 21-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a light grocery and stationery shop. When she is not in her shop, she serves as a Cama member (Camfed alumnae network).  As a Cama member, she delivers 'My Better World' sessions in schools that are within her community. With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of stationery, maize, rice, sugar, salt, and flour from wholesalers at lower costs. This will enhance her sales and profit levels. She would also be able to expand her business and create even more employment in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of stationery and groceries.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 57-year-old mother who owns and manages a small retail store within the rural community. She aims to improve her store in order to gain a higher income. Flora wants to acquire more goods to sell but she has insufficient capital. 

For this reason, Flora wants to access financial assistance amounting to PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of grocery items and various vegetables such as tomatoes, eggplants, sweet potatoes and beans to sell. Flora is hoping that she will obtain her loan request to enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and various vegetables such as tomatoes, eggplants, sweet potatoes and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To upgrade the equipment in her salon.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 48-year-old married man with five children, ages 21, 19, 17, 15, and 11 years old – all attending different schools. He is a farmer who grows coffee, maize, and beans. He sells his products to fellow traders. He works six days a week and eight hours a day and has been a farmer since 1994. However, he faces the challenges of unfavorable weather conditions (like drought) and poor markets, which affect his business. He is motivated by the fact that it is a permanent business and in his area of expertise. Peter is also an internal officer (GSO) located in a rural area from which he gains additional income that he uses to support his family. 

Peter hopes to use this loan to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation so that he can increase his output. His hope and dream is to expand his business, provided he gets capital. He is described as an honest and hardworking man in the business. He appreciates lenders for the services offered.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank resides in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 41 and is married with four children aged between 18 and three, two of whom attend school. Frank has a video hall and earns additional income from selling sodas (depot). His aim is to grow his business. Stiff competition is still a major challenge to his business.

Frank is acquiring a loan to buy a motorcycle to assist him with transport while monitoring his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to assist him with transport while monitoring his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of slippers, sandals and shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase better quality clothes in bulk so that she can attract more clients.

loans.name: Oppa

texts.en: Oppa is a 26-year-old businesswoman and married mother of two children.  She is from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. With her family’s assistance, Oppa runs a poultry project at the local business center where she produces 60 broiler birds every six weeks. When she is not selling chickens, Oppo works as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at a nearby school.  Here she helps young students reach their goals and develop leadership skills. With the Kiva loan, Oppa intends to make bulk purchases of chicks, vaccines, and feed to boost production volumes and thus increase profits.  With the money she will earn, Oppa will build her parents a house, provide for her family, and pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of chicks, vaccines, and feed.

loans.name: Keren

texts.en:
Keren is 21 years old and lives in the Lupane district of Zimbabwe. She runs her own business sewing and selling duvets, seat covers, and cushion covers. She has been in this business for three years now and would love to see it expand.  Apart from running her business, Keren also serves as a community health activist who disseminates health information to the people of her community. 

With the material purchased with the requested loan, Keren intends to produce more products because at the moment she cannot meet the demand due to lack of capital. With the additional profits, she would like to retake the basic level subjects that she did not pass.

loans.use: To purchase more material to produce more duvets and seat covers.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 60 years old and lives alone in Gori district. Nanuli is involved in agricultural activities. She owns a small plot of agricultural land where she grows vegetables to sell. 

As she is experienced in selling vegetables, Nanuli has decided to start a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to receive a loan of 800 Gel to begin a trading business. She will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and will resell at higher prices. Nanuli has regular clients and thinks that the business will be profitable and she will earn more income. Nanuli awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in fruits and vegetables to increase the family's income

loans.name: Siguitemogoson Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMOGOSON est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Biba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de l’habillement et de produit cosmétique. 
Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMOGOSON sont à leur  vingt sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente SATA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de  l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Dioïla. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Siguitemogoson group consists of married women who on average are 38 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Biba in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell cereals, condiments, clothing and cosmetics.

The Siguitemogoson group of women are on their twenty-sixth group loan. To meet their customers' huge demand, they seek assistance from Soro Yiriwaso.

Sata is the first person standing from right to left. She is illiterate and currently sells clothing. She intends to buy lengths of pagne wax (colorful West-African fabric) from wholesalers in Dioïla.

Retail sales are conducted at the market, for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to make monthly profits of 18,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
Santos es un joven trabajador de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, actualmente está soltero  y vive con su padre y sus tres hermanos, con su padre son los encargados de mantener a su familia. 

Desde hace 5 años Santos se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, y aprendió debido a que su padre se dedica al mismo negocio, y también vende frutas y verduras, el trabajo lo realiza en pick-up en varias comunidades cercanas de donde viven y el horario es de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm.  

El crédito lo necesita para invertir en el negocio de frutas y verduras, en variedad, además compraran pescado fresco para la venta, y otra parte del crédito es para comprar unos repuestos del vehículo.
 
Su sueño en el negocio es vender toda la mercadería para poder así seguir invirtiendo más, también tener venta en su casa como una tienda para vender lo más necesario para la gente.
texts.en:
Santos is a young worker of 20 years of age. He studied until the ninth grade. He is currently single and lives with his father and his three siblings. With his father, they are the ones in charge of supporting their family.

For the last five years, Santos has worked in the buying and selling of scrap metal, and he learned because his father works in the same business, and he also sells fruits and vegetables. He carries out his work in a pick-up in various communities near where they live and the schedule is from 7:00am to 5:00pm.

He needs the loan to invest in the variety of his fruit and vegetable business. In addition, they will also buy fresh fish to sell, and another part of the loan is to purchase some vehicle replacement parts.

His business dream is to sell all of the merchandise so that he will be able to continue investing more, and also to have sales in his house like a store to sell what people need most.

loans.use: to invest in the variety of his fruit and vegetable business, buy fresh fish to sell, and buy some vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 40-year-old married man with eight children whose ages range from 17 to 8 years old and all attend different schools. He deals in the bark cloth business and works for five days a week and four hours a day. He is motivated by the fact that it is a family business, so he has experience with it.

He is also a farmer who grows coffee and beans and from this, he generates additional income to support his family. He hopes to use the loan to buy more bark cloth (traditional cloth) to sell to his customers so that his business can expand. His hope and dream is to buy cows for fattening so that he can benefit more from cattle trading. He is an honest and hardworking man in business.

loans.use: To buy bark cloth to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her coffee crops in this new season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of shoes, sandals, and trainers so that she can increase her sales and profits

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BALIMAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de savon et d’articles divers. 
Les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAMOU, personne assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers. Elle compte acheter des cartons de boucle d’oreille, de collier et de bague chez les grossistes à Bamako.
 La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group consists of married women who on average are 37 years old with two children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell food preparations, condiments, soap and various items.

The Balimaya group of women are on their ninth group loan. To meet their customers' huge demand, they seek assistance from Soro Yiriwaso.

Mamou, the person who is kneeling, is illiterate and currently sells various items. She intends to buy cartons of ear-rings, necklaces and rings from wholesalers in Bamako.

Retail sales are conducted for cash, at her home and sometimes as an itinerant vendor, to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 45,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 50 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y tienen su propia familia solo tiene un nieto que esta con él.


Jorge se dedica a trabajar en un camión con el que hace viajes de todo tipo, además se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, cultiva una hectárea de maíz, los viajes los hace dependiendo el lugar que lo soliciten, la agricultura la realiza en época de invierno.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes, además para reparar el camión ya que lo tiene arruinado.

Él sueña con seguir trabajando, mantener a su familia y llevar el sustento diario para su casa.
texts.en:
Jorge is 50 years old, he studied up to 8th grade, his companion in life takes care of the household chores, his children are older now and have their own family, he has only one grandchild living with him.

Jorge works in a truck with which he does all types of trips, furthermore he works in agriculture, he farms a hectare of corn, he does the trips depending on the places he's asked to go to, the agriculture is done during the summer season.

The loan funds will be used to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizer, also to repair his truck which has broken down.

He dreams to continuing to work, taking care of this family and providing for his family from day to day.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers, also to repair a broken-down truck.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: As a Wedza District of Zimbabwe resident, Patience offers guidance and support to secondary school children as a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer. At 27 years old, she also runs her own business.  Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. Patience started the business when her family started facing financial difficulties last year, and Patience knew that poultry production is a thriving business in her community. With the Kiva loan, Patience will purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. In fact, she would like to become a supplier to major supermarkets. With more income, Patience will be able to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Luisa Del Pilar

texts.es: Luisa de 39 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos de 13 y 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer visionaria que desde hace 3 años compra granos básicos como: frijol, maíz, arroz y maicillo para luego venderlos en su cantón. Luisa desea renovar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: madera, lámina, teja y vara de castilla para renovar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis, 39 years old, lives with her 2 children of 13 and 16 years old. She is a visionary woman who for 3 years has bought staple grains such as beans, corn, rice and millet to later sell them in her canton.

Luisa wants to renovate the food of her dwelling which currently is in a state of deterioration, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: wood, sheet metal, tiles and wooden rods to renovate the roof of her dwelling.

loans.use: to buy wood, sheet metal, tiles and wooden rods to renovate the roof of her dwelling.

loans.name: Yida Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe YIDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans  et le moins âgé a  06ans. Les 03 vont à l’école et elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et du savon depuis  16ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter 20complet pagnes.
Mme veut  épargne ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne renforcer son activité et assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata is responsible for the Yida group. She is the married mother of three children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest six. All three attend school and she has six persons to care for.

She has been selling pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) and soap for the past sixteen years. She resupplies in the town markets, and wants to buy 20 full sets of pagnes.

She wants to put her profits into savings, and aims to strengthen her business and ensure her children's future.

loans.use: buy 20 sets of pagnes

loans.name: Ivis Rodolfo

texts.es:
Ivis es un hombre trabajador de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en un cafetín, tiene 3 hijos que viven con ellos, los cuales 2 trabajan y el menor estudia 7° grado, de él dependen sus hijos y su esposa. 

Desde hace 7 años Ivis tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas y se dedicó al trabajo pues aprendió desde su niñez como ayudante de otros talleres, ahora trabaja en su casa y su hijo le ayuda en el negocio, el horario de trabajo es de 7: 00 am a 5:00 pm.

Él solicita el crédito para comprar herramientas de trabajo, una pulidora y reparar el compresor, mejorará su negocio ya que esas herramientas son indispensables para desarrollar el trabajo. 

En un futuro él desea remodelar el taller, hacerlo más amplio, y seguir dándole el estudio su hijo hasta que sea profesional, las ganancias lo invertirá para la compra de otras herramientas más avanzadas.
texts.en:
Ivis is a hardworking man of 37 years of age. He studied until the ninth grade. He is married and his wife works in a small café. He has three children who live with them, of which two work and the youngest studies in seventh grade. His children and wife depend on him.

For the last seven years, Ivis has had a workshop of metallic structures and he began working in this field because he learned it from his childhood as a helper in other workshops. Now he works in his house and his son helps him with the business. The work schedule is from 7:00am to 5:00pm.

He requests the loan in order to buy work tools, a polishing machine, and to repair the compressor. It will improve his business since those tools are indispensable to carrying out the work. 

In the future he wishes to remodel the workshop, make it bigger, and continue giving his son an education until he becomes a professional. He will invest the earnings to buy other more advanced tools.

loans.use: to buy work tools, a polishing machine, and repair the compressor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cloth and a variety of other clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KAYIRA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, l’habillement, de savon, d’ustensile de cuisine en plastique et de divers. 
Les femmes du groupe KAYIRA sont à leur dix-huitième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente RAMATA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’ustensile de cuisine en plastique. Elle compte acheter des sceaux, des tasses et des bassines chez les grossistes à Bamako.
 La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 120 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kayira group consists of married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell cereals, clothing, soap, kitchen utensils and various items.

The Kayira group of women are on their eighteenth group loan. To meet their customers' huge demand, they seek assistance from Soro Yiriwaso.

Ramata, the first person kneeling from left to right, is illiterate and currently sells plastic kitchen utensils. She intends to buy pails, cups and basins from wholesalers in Bamako.

Retail sales are conducted for cash at the market, to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 120,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy plastic kitchen utensils

loans.name: Jaime Francisco

texts.es: Jaime de 19 años de edad vive con su abuela y una hermana. Él es un joven trabajador que se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado y además es empleado de una pequeña comercial. Jaime desea hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda como: encementar el piso, cambiar la madera del techo por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: madera, cemento, arena y grava, también deberá pagar mano de obra para realizar dichas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jaime is 19 years old and lives with his grandmother and a sister. He is a hardworking young person who works raising and selling cattle, and also he is an employee at a small business.

Jaime wishes to make some improvements to his dwelling such as: cementing the floor and changing the wood of the roof so for this he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: wood, cement, sand and gravel, he will also have to pay for the manual labor to make the aforementioned improvements to his dwelling.

loans.use: to buy wood, cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor and change the wood on the roof of his dwelling.

loans.name: Isaac Adalberto

texts.es:
Isaac tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, trabaja en la agricultura y es motorista de un camión en una hacienda, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen un hijo de 2 años de edad.


Isaac se dedica a trabajar como motorista de un camión en una hacienda, esto lo ha desempeñado desde hace 3 años, para ello tiene que madrugar para llegar temprano, con el camión tiene que trasladar alimento para las vacas.
En época de invierno también se dedica a trabajar la agricultura en la siembra de una hectárea de maíz esto lo pudo aprender de su padre quien también se dedica a trabajar la tierra.

Lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y para la preparación de las tierra donde va a sembrar.

Su sueño en un futuro es comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa, comprar animales bovinos ya que sería una fuente de ingreso para él y su familia
texts.en:
Isaac is 29 years old. He studied until the ninth grade. He works in agriculture and is a truck driver on a ranch. His life partner does domestic work and they have a 2-year-old son.

Isaac works as a truck driver on a ranch. He has carried this out for the last three years, and for it he has to get up early in order to arrive early. He has to move cow feed with the truck. 

In the winter season he also works in agriculture in the planting of a hectare of corn. He was able to learn this from his father who also works the land.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer, manure, and to prepare the land where he is going to plant.

His future dream is to buy a piece of land where he can build a house and buy bovine animals, since it would be a source of income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to prepare the land where he will plant.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NIETA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de savon et de charbon de bois. 
Les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAMOU, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, de l’huile, de la farine boulangère et des condiments chez les grossistes à Bamako.
 La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa gargote au bord du goudron à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Nieta group consists of married women who on average are 37 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell food preparations, soap and charcoal.

The Nieta group of women are on their sixth group loan. To meet their customers' huge demand, they seek assistance from Soro Yiriwaso.

Mamou, the second person from right to left, is illiterate and currently runs a restaurant business. She intends to buy rice, oil, baking flour and condiments from wholesalers in Bamako.

Meals are sold for cash at her roadside eatery, to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 70,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is 49 years old. She lives in the Martvili district. Mzia runs an agricultural business. She has two cows and three calves. In addition, she has nut trees and sells the harvested nuts locally. Mzia decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,200 GEL to purchase cheese and start trading. This will increase Mzia's income and she will be able to improve her living conditions. Mzia awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading cheese and increase her income

loans.name: Onnah

texts.en: Onnah is a 25-year-old entrepreneur from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a stall at the local flea market, selling various clothes and school uniforms. When she is not working at her stall, Onnah volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide.  With the Kiva loan, she intends to purchase more clothes to increase sales and profits. With the additional profits, Onnah would like to financially support her siblings through school.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing so that she can increase her sales and profit levels.

loans.name: Euphrasia I.

texts.en:
Euphrasia is a 21-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a store, where she sells groceries, for a year now. She also volunteers as a community health worker who disseminates health information to the people of her community. 

With the requested loan, she intends to make bulk purchases of groceries, expand her business, and create employment for the people of her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of groceries, expand her business, and create employment for the people of her community.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 48-year-old married man with 12 children, including some aged 21, 20, 19, 18 and17 years, with 10 children attending different schools. He has two other dependants he takes care of because they are orphans. He deals in a furniture and lumbering business, and he works for six days a week and 12 hours a day. He was motivated by the fact that it was his profession and area of expertise.

He is also a farmer who grows maize, beans and tomatoes, plus rears animals, from which he gains an additional income that he uses to support his family. He hopes to use the loan to buy more furniture for his business and also open up a new furniture store in Kalisizo town, so that his business expands.

He sells his furniture to fellow carpenters and constructors around Kyotera and surrounding areas. His hopes and dreams are to buy a plot in Kyotera and construct a maize mill. He is described as an honest and hardworking man in business and appreciates lenders for the services offered.

loans.use: To buy furniture for selling

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reymundo es un hombre de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo y se dedica a la fabricación de muebles en hierro.
Él es una persona humilde y muy trabajadora su labor la viene realizando desde hace quince años en la ciudad de ”El Alto” - Bolivia. Los muebles que fabrica son creaciones propias y artísticas en hierro forjado, tanto para interiores como exteriores.
Reymundo es de tez morena cabello negro corto, estatura mediana y casi siempre viste ropa de trabajo. Los muebles dado sus materiales tienen una gran resistencia a las inclemencias del tiempo, las herramientas que utiliza son: arco soldador, esmeril, fresadora, lijadora, taladros, etc., su esposa colabora en la exposición y venta de los muebles labor que la realiza en la feria de su ciudad, todos los jueves y domingos de cada semana. Su sueño es tener una tienda dónde pueda exponer y vender sus muebles, para llegar a eso debe incrementar su producción, comprando materia prima (hierro) y nuevas herramientas.
Es por esos motivos que Reymundo solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo y entonces cumplir su sueño y darle un futuro mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Reymundo is a 34 year old man, he lives with his partner, he has a son and works making iron furnishings. He is a humble person who is very hardworking, he has been working for fifteen years in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. The furnishings he makes are his own artistic creations in  wrought iron, both for indoors and outdoors.

Reymundo has a dark complexion, short black hair, is of medium height and almost always wears work clothes. The furnishings, due to the material, have great resistance to the weather, the tools he uses are: an ARC welder, grinder, milling cutter, sander, drills, etc., his wife helps in the display and sale of the furnishings which takes place in the city fair, ever Thursday and Sunday, every week.

His dream is to have his own shop where he can exhibit and sell his furniture, to achieve this he must increase his production, buying raw materials (iron) and new tools.

It is for these reasons that Reymundo is requesting a loan to buy tools of his trade and thus reach his dream and give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools and thus reach his dream and give his family a better future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruits and kapenta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell, allowing her to increase sales and profit margins.

loans.name: Siphindinkosi

texts.en:
Siphindinkosi is a 19-year-old businesswoman who lives in the Lupane District of Zimbabwe. She has been operating a small shop where she sells groceries such as sugar, salt, and cooking oil. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide in her community, teaching life skills to students at her local secondary school every week. 

With the loan she is requesting from Kiva, she would like to purchase more groceries to sell to increase the sales and profits. She plans to meet the financial needs of her family using the additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Della

texts.en:
Della is a 32-year-old mother of four from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She is a businesswoman who has been running a flea market for the past two years. When she is not selling shoes, clothes, and handbags in her shop, Della participates in community clean-up activities and volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local school. 

Della intends to purchase more clothes, shoes, and handbags with the Kiva loan to increase sales and profits. With the additional profits, she would like to expand her business and create employment opportunities for the people of her community.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mamota

texts.en: Mamota, 24, is an industrious woman who lives in Narendrapur village, West Bengal. She is married. She is a young and energetic woman.  She runs a small rice mill and works in the fields. Her husband helps her in this business. She is finding it difficult to run the family with the small income generated from the rice mill. Hence, she plans to take a loan of INR 20,000 to buy equipment for the mill that will help her expand her business and earn more.  She dreams of running this business on a large scale. She hopes to save enough for her future and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her rice mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock with more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats so she can slaughter them and sell them to butcheries

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a 19-year-old entrepreneur from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She operates a grocery store where she sells sugar, washing soap, cotton wool, and body creams. Yvonne also teaches life skills as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide.  

With the requested loan, she intends to purchase her grocery items in bulk from wholesalers in order to increase profits. With the additional profits, Yvonne would like to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To increase her stock of grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en: Sinikiwe is the married mother of two children and lives in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in a community school as a Camfed Learner Guide, offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. Over the past year, Sinikiwe has been running a poultry business that produces about 100 broiler birds every 6 weeks. She started the business when she wanted to increase her family’s income and she knew that poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Sinikiwe intends to increase her sales volume and profits, so she will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable her to provide for her children’s needs, as well as pay school fees for her two siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Durga

texts.en: Durga is a 45-year old woman who is married and has a son and three daughters, all of whom are studying. The family is living in Madhumsadhan village, West Bengal. Her husband is a daily wage worker.  Durga cultivates paddy on her own land and she takes land on lease to grow more paddy. The village she is based in is covered with agriculture land, ponds and the river, so agriculture is suitable in this area. Durga is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. This will give her better quality crops by the end of the season. She hopes to save enough for a higher education for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Annapurna

texts.en:
Annapurna lives in Narendrapur village, West Bengal with her husband who is a farmer. Her daughter is married and her son is studying in 12th grade. She joined Madhabilata Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO Sabuj Sangha. 
 
Annapurna is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer in order to have a high quality harvest from her rice farm. She hopes this will improve her income, which she wants to save for her son’s education.

In the future, she wants to run a rice mill in her village.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is a young businesswoman who lives in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe with her parents. She specializes in agriculture, farming beans for a living. She also volunteers as a community health activist who disseminates health information to the people of her community. 

With the loan she is requesting from Kiva, she would like to purchase more seeds, fertilizers, and chemicals so that she can increase the production of beans. With increased production of beans, she would receive an increase in profits, allowing her to pay fees for her to train as a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds, fertilizers, and chemicals so that she can increase the production of beans.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita, 42, is living in Nandakumarpur village, West Bengal. She is married and has a son and daughter. Her son is studying ITI while her daughter is studying for her M.A. The main source of income for the family is through agriculture on the cultivable land they own. The husband and wife work very hard so that they can give a better life to their children by educating them.
 
Lalita’s family income is not sufficient to pay for her children's education fees. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of INR 30,000 to pay for their fees. She wants her kids to do well and hold good jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education fees

loans.name: Manomila

texts.en:
Manomila is in her 40s and hails from Narendrapur village in South 24 Praganas, West Bengal. The area is located in Sundarban, which receives good rainfall and is dotted with ponds.

Manomila has two children; her daughter is married and her son is studying in fifth grade.

Manomila has some agriculture land and she cultivates paddy. She wants to improve her agriculture land. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of INR 25,000 to buy fertilizers, seeds and other things that will be used for farming. She hopes to make some profits and save enough for her son’s education. 

She is currently not well-off and with her realistic requirements, she hopes to bring stability in her life and become a successful rural entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (oranges and peanuts) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase production by buying seed, herbicides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the stock at her general store.

loans.name: Loreen

texts.en:
Loreen is a 30-year-old businesswoman who is a mother of two children living in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She has been running a business where she sells hair extensions, hair relaxers, and other hair creams. Loreen also volunteers with Camfed as a community activist, promoting the importance of education. 

With the requested loan, she would like to purchase hair extensions, relaxers, and creams in bulk from wholesalers at a reduced price, allowing her to sell her products at a more favorable price. With the additional profits, she would like to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, relaxers, and creams in bulk from wholesalers at a reduced price, allowing her to sell her products at a more favorable price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Kudzanai

texts.en: Kudzanai is a young businesswoman from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers at the local school as a Camfed Learner Guide where she focuses on promoting education to young students. When she is not at her weekly volunteer position, Kaudzanai runs her poultry business in order to combat financial difficulties. Kudzanai is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can purchase broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and boost sales. She will be able to build a much bigger fowl run and continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and boost sales.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati, 48, lives in Nandakumarpur village, West Bengal with her family. She has five daughters. Three of her daughters are married and two are studying in 10th and 8th grade, respectively. She cultivates crops in her agriculture farm and sells them for a living. 

Malati is a member of Dipabali Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO Sabuj Sangha. She has always repaid her previous loans on time. 

Malati is requesting a loan of INR 20,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing vegetables.
 
She is thankful to the investors for the loan. She hopes to save her income for her daughters’ education and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for growing vegetables

loans.name: José Ismael

texts.es:
José tiene 66 años de edad, su familia está conformada  solo por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos ya que sus hijos tienen su hogar aparte.

 José se dedica a la agricultura, él se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja en otras parcelas o cuidando sus animales.

 
	Él necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas como semilla, veneno, abono, y para la rastreada de la tierra, etc. para sembrar una parcela que espera le produzca una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.
.

Sus planes en un futuro son incursionar en sembrar jícama.
texts.en:
Jose is 66 years old, his family is made up of only his wife, who supports him with the domestic chores as his children have their separate homes.

Jose works in agriculture, he gets up at 4:30am to go to work during the morning in the plot of land that he rents and for the rest of the day he works on other plots or takes care of his animals.

He needs this loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, pesticide, fertilizer and rake the land, etc. for sowing the plot of land which he hopes will produce a good harvest as food for his family.

His plans for the future are to dabble in planting jicama [Mexican yams or Mexican turnips].

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, pesticide, fertilizer and rake the land, etc. to sow a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Manasi

texts.en:
Every parent wants to earn at least enough so she can provide her children with education and facilities, to make them capable of standing on their feet and reaching the zenith of success in their life. And this hope gets shattered daily because of lack of knowledge, training and capital in rural areas of India. But the NGO Sabuj Sangha provides requisite knowledge, training and motivation to women to be independent. 

Manasi is a member of Madhabilata Self-Help Group of Sabuj Sangha. She is married and has a son and two daughters. One of her daughters is studying for her  B.A. while her son and other daughter are studying in 9th and 5th grade, respectively.

She has some cultivable land where she grows paddy. She also works in a pre-school as a cook. It is difficult to support her family with the income generated from these activities.
