She wants to have a good yield. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of INR 10,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds.  

She wants to save enough money for her kids’ education so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fuleswari

texts.en:
Fuleswari is an industrious woman who lives in Narendrapur village, West Bengal. She is married and has three daughters. The eldest, Mousumi, is studying in third grade, Palabi goes to pre-school and Arpita is a newborn baby. 

Fuleswari runs a small rice mill and works in agriculture fields but she is finding it difficult to run the family with the small income she is generating from these activities. She is requesting a loan of INR 10,000 to buy one more machine for her rice mill, which will help her have more customers. She dreams of having a bigger mill in the future. She hopes to make some profit, save enough for her daughters' education and lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy a machine for her rice mill

loans.name: Radharani

texts.en:
Radharani lives in Nandakumarpur village, West Bengal. She is married and the mother of three children. The daughters are studying in 10th and 5th grade, respectively, while her son is still a baby.
 
Radharani cultures fish for a living. The income generated is not sufficient to fulfill the basic needs of the family. So Radharani is seeking a loan of INR 20,000 to buy manure, raw materials and food for the fish. 

With the additional income, she wants to educate her children and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure, raw materials and food for the fish

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: María de 55 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 nietos en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida desde hace 6 años vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, además posee un molino de nixtamal lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y poder mantener la economía de su hogar. María desea mejorar algunas áreas de su cocina ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta se encuentra bastante dañada por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, grava, arena, lámina y madera para mejorar el techo y el piso de su cocina.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old, she lives with her husband and her 2 grandchildren in her own home. She is a hardworking woman who has made a living for 6 years selling staple products from home, furthermore she has a corn mill which allows her to earn a livelihood and be able to maintain the family finances.

Maria wants to improve some parts of her kitchen as can be seen in the photograph, it is quite damaged so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, gravel, sand sheet metal and wood to improve the roof and the floor of her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand and wood to improve the roof and the floor of her kitchen.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: Valentín de 63 años de edad habita en casa propia. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se gana la vida desde hace 30 años como tejedor de colchas y manteles, además cuando se le solicita se desempeña como albañil. Valentín desea mejorar las paredes y el piso de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra para el repello de las paredes y encementado de piso.
texts.en:
Valentín is 63 years old and lives in his own home. He is a very hardworking man who has made a living for 30 years as a weaver of blankets and tablecloths, also when he is asked he does construction work.

Valentín wants to improve the walls and the floor of his dwelling so he his requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel and pay for manual labor to whitewash the walls and cement the floor of his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and pay for manual labor to make improvements to the walls and floor of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods such as palm oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shelves, ceiling patchwork and stock before the holidays.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the inventory for her clothing stall.

loans.name: Vaneza Estephanie

texts.es: Vaneza de 26 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 7 y 1 año de edad, la mayor se encuentra estudiando. Vaneza es una mujer luchadora quien se gana la vida desde hace 3 años como vendedora de diferentes productos por catálogo, su compañero de vida se desempeña como electricista desde hace 5 años y juntos mantienen el equilibrio de la economía de su hogar. Vaneza desea mejorar su servicio sanitario para lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: taza de inodoro lavable, cemento y arena, además pagará mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de una fosa séptica.
texts.en:
Vaneza is 26 years old and lives with her life partner and her two daughters of 7 and 1 years old, the older goes to school. Vaneza is a fighter who has made a living for three years selling catalogue products, her life partner has been an electrician for 5 years and together they maintain the economic balance of the home.

Vaneza wants to improve her sanitary services, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: a washable toilet bowl, cement, sand, and pay for manual labor for the work necessary for the construction of a septic tank.

loans.use: to buy: a washable toilet bowl, cement, sand, and pay for manual labor for the construction of a septic tank.

loans.name: Heather

texts.en: Heather is a young businesswoman who lives in the Binga District of Zimbabwe where she sells dried fish. When she is not working, Heather teaches life skills as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide. With a Kiva loan, Heather will purchase more fish directly from fishers at lower costs. That way she can meet the demand for fish and increase her sales and profits. With the additional income, Heather would like to pay her siblings’ school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by making bulk purchases of sugar, salt, cooking oil, and snacks

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is a 20-year-old businesswoman. She lives in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a small shop selling snacks, cotton wool, sugar, salt, and cooking oil.  She also volunteers as a Learner Guide who delivers "My Better World" sessions in her local secondary school teaching students life skills. With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of groceries from wholesalers where the costs are lower. This would help her increase sales and profit levels. With the additional income, she hopes to build her own shop, reduce costs on rentals, and create even more employment in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of groceries from wholesalers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel, purlins and bolts, and to pay labourers to finish building her home.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad vive con su sobrino mayor de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir en su domicilio, también vive con ella su sobrino el cual aporta a la economía familiar. María desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina, madera, clavos y pernos para la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 53 years old and lives with her nephew, now an adult. María is an enterprising woman who earns a living making clothes in her home. Her nephew also supports the household economy. María wants to build a room in her home and so is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and bolts to build a room in her home.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and bolts to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 57 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 23, 21 y 20 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad, además su hijo mayor también trabaja prestando servicios de seguridad y gracias a ello aporta a la economía familiar. Francisco desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y pernos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 57 years old and lives with his wife and three children, aged 23, 21 and 20 years old each. Francisco is hard-working and earns a living as a security guard. His eldest son does the same work and, because of it, supports the family economy.

Francisco wants to replace the roof on his home and so is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and bolts.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and bolts to replace the roof on one of the rooms in his home.

loans.name: Dialabaton I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DIALABATON I est constitué de 10 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. La plupart d’entre eux vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Kobli un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe DIALABATON I collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (mil, arachide, sésame, haricot etc.) 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Madame SITAN, personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheter de la semence, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 1 hectare de sorgho.
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Fana.
Elle envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 90 000F CFA par campagne qui sera investi dans le commerce.
Les femmes du groupe DIALABATON I se disent satisfaites de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable et fructueuse.
texts.en:
The Dialabaton I group is made up of 10 married women, who are all around 36 years old, with 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kobli, one of the villages in the prefecture of Dioila, in the Koulikoro Region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The Dialabaton I women are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to improve their winter activities. Their harvests are, among others, millet, peanuts, sesame, beans etc.
 
They are on their ninth collaboration with the organisation. 
With this loan, Madam SITAN, the lady in the middle of the seated women, aims to pay her labour and hoeing costs, as well as purchasing seeds, fertiliser, herbicide and other basic tolls in order to cultivate her 1 hectare field of sorghum. 

Following the harvest, the crops are sold for cash in Fana. 
She aims to generated an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA per harvest, which will be reinvested in the business. The Dialabaton I group women are happy with the Soro Yiriwaso collaboration and are confident in sustainable and fruitful harvests.

loans.use: Labour, seeds, fertiliser, herbicide, hoeing and basic tools

loans.name: Wendtongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE est responsable du groupe WENDTONGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a13 ans  et le moins âgé a  04ans   . Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme fait la couture depuis  08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés approximatifs.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 nouvelle machine à coudre.
Mme veut épargne ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir s’acquérir une nouvelle machine à broder. Elle ambitionne toujours assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mme SOLANGE is the leader of the Wendtongo group. She is married and has two children, aged 4 and 13, who both attend school. She also has 4 people in her care. 
She has been a seamstress for 8 years, and sources her goods from the nearby markets. She would like to purchase a new sewing machine. She would like to save her profits in order to purchase a new embroidery machine, and to see to her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mauricio Roberto

texts.es: Mauricio de 33 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 11 y 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida como albañil en una empresa desde hace 7 años. Mauricio desea ampliar un cuarto de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina, madera y clavos para ampliar un cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mauricio is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters, aged eleven and five years old each. Mauricio is an enterprising man who has been earning a living as a builder working for another business for seven years. Mauricio wants to extend a room in his home and so is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to extend a room in his home.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco de 45 años de edad vive  con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 23, 16, 14, 12 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en su domicilio, además realiza viajes a diferentes partes de su localidad lo cual le  permite tener un ingreso extra. Marco, también, siembra maíz para consumo y venta. Marco desea reparar  la galera de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía se encuentra en mal estado es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: madera, lámina galvanizada, clavos y pernos para mejorar las condiciones de la galera.
texts.en: Marco is 45 years old and lives with his wife and five children, who are 23, 16, 14, 12 and 6 years old each. Marco is hard-working and earns a living selling groceries in his home. He also offers transport services, allowing him to earn a little extra money. In addition Marco grows corn for his own consumption and to sell. Marco wants to repair the shed in his home. As can be seen in the photo, it is in bad condition and so Marco is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy wood, metal sheeting, nails and bolts to repair the shed at his home.

loans.use: to buy wood, metal sheeting, nails and bolts to repair the shed at his home.

loans.name: Nancy Susana

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y se dedica al arte del macramé en mantas de baile.
Ella es de carácter alegre y muy trabajadora, su negocio es un emprendimiento que lo heredó de su madre y que lo viene realizando desde hace siete años.
Nancy es de tez morena, ojos obscuros, cabello largo y estatura mediana, su familia es migrante de la zona del altiplano boliviano, ella terminó la escuela secundaria y comenzó su labor de tejido a tiempo completo. Esta labor la viene realizando desde muy niña, al principio era un juego, un pasatiempo con el que ayudaba con los gastos del hogar a su familia, con el tiempo se convirtió en su forma de vida. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ de la ciudad de Él Alto’. En ese lugar ella tiene un puesto de venta donde expone sus trabajos. Sus tejidos son mantas hechas a mano y su labor consiste en realizar diferentes tipos de nudos con hilos de algodón, yute, lino, seda y otras fibras naturales, hasta llegar a la confección de una manta para ser usada como abrigo.
Nancy se especializa en la creación de mantas para grupos de bailes folclóricos, su sueño es vestir a cientos de bailarines y tener su propia marca, para eso, ella necesita invertir dinero para la compra de material de trabajo y confeccionar mantas para la festividad de la zona 16 de julio.
Es por esos motivos que Nancy solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos y material de trabajo y algún día llegar a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Nancy is 19-years-old, single and has no children. She does macrame in order to produce blankets for dancing.

Nancy is a happy and hard-working young woman. She inherited this business from her mother and has been working at it for seven years now.

Nancy is of dark complexion with dark eyes, long hair, and medium height. Nancy's family migrated from the Bolivian high Andean plateau. Nancy completed secondary school and started working with macrame full time. She has been doing macrame since she was a little girl. Before it was just a hobby but now it is a way to earn a living. Nancy's business is in the 16 de julio district of El Alto city. Here she has a stall where she displays her work. Nancy's products are hand-made blankets; she works making different kinds of stitches with threads made with cotton, jute, flax, silk, and other natural fibres. She puts together the blankets to use to keep warm.

Nancy specialises in making blankets for folk dancing groups. Her dream is to be able to dress hundreds of dancers and have her own brand. In order to do this she needs to invest money to buy materials and make more blankets for festivities in the 16 de julio area.

Given this need for material, Nancy is applying for a loan so that she can buy threads and materials for her work in order to achieve her dreams one day.

loans.use: to buy threads and materials for her work in order to achieve her dreams one day.

loans.name: Tres Marias Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de libreria, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the group "Tres Marías." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, and belongs to the Province of Cusco and the Department of Cusco.  

The group member is Hilda.  She lives with her life partner, is 36 years old and has 1 child.  She works in her restaurant.  She prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups and salted meats.  She works from 10am until 5pm.  She has been working in this field for 8 years and things are going well.  Her dream is to grow her restaurant business.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase products for cooking such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

The other group members work in a bookstore, selling vegetables, selling groceries, and running a restaurant.

Hilda is grateful for Kiva lenders and all those who form part of making her dream a reality through this medium.  She promises to repay her loan according to the established guidelines.

loans.use: to purchase products for cooking in her restaurant such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Talent

texts.en: Talent is a 22-year-old single young woman living in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, assisting to improve the learning environment of students in local schools. She has been running a poultry business since 2012, producing 100 birds every six weeks. With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. An improvement in the business will mean that she will be able to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk so that her sales and profits increase.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay college tuition.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Shedrak, Salomi, and  Christopah. Isiyaku is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Isiyaku will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Isiyaku can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Isiyaku is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose está en el cuarto año de la carrera de administración, esta trabajando a la vez que estudia, y le gustaría poder terminar sus estudios para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y sabe que por medio de sus estudios podrá hacerlo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Jose is in his fourth year of a management career. He is working and studying at the same time, and would like to finish his career to be something in life. He wants to improve his life conditions, and knows he can do it through studying. He is requesting this loan to pay for his college fees and be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Alh. Umaru

texts.en: Alh. Umaru is a Babban Gona farmer from Garin Darau. Alh. Umaru expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Alh. Umaru to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alh. Umaru can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alh. Umaru is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Alh. Umaru will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said“I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland." With this loan, Alh. Umaru will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en:
Roun is a 44-year-old mother from a rural area located in the Chorm Ksan district, where rice farming is a common way to earn a living. As a married mother, she has struggled to feed her three children by farming rice and raising chickens and ducks. She has been doing this kind of work for five years, currently earning approximately 22,500 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. 

This is Roun's first loan with VisionFund and she is leading her group of borrowers. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy solar panels. She hopes to have electricity to use, especially at night time for her family.

loans.use: to buy solar panels

loans.name: Halluru

texts.en: Halluru remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Halluru, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Halluru  is ambitious and is aiming to reap a total of 20 bags on his 0.2ha field.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Halluru. With this loan, Halluru is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es:
Yohana es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, hoy está en el 4to. año, con mucho sacrificio a punto de recibirse.
Ella comenta que está casada, que tiene un hijo. Ella aspira para el futuro formar su propia empresa en donde pueda seguir creciendo cada vez, cada día más como profesional y poder también ayudar proporcionando fuentes de trabajo a otras personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que está a punto de poder terminar su carrera y quiere cubrir ese gasto.
texts.en:
Yohana studies Business Administration. With much sacrifice she has reached the 4th year and is now nearing graduation.

She says that she is married and as a son. She hopes that she will be able to set up her own business in the future. With her business, she wants to continue growing each day to become ever more professional and to be able to offer employment to other people.

She asks for a loan in order to pay the fees for her graduation, because she is at the final point of her studies and wants to be able to pay this fee.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fee.

loans.name: Bartolina

texts.es:
Bartolina es Estudiante Universitaria, está cursando el ultimo año de la Carrera de Licenciatura en Farmacia, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora estudia  para salir adelante,  es casada su marido es Docente catedrático.
Es muy dedicada a sus estudios y que siempre alcanzar sus metas. Su sueño es terminar esta carrera y el día de mañana Montar una farmacia en su propia casa.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en gastos de tesina, ya que tiene muchos gastos que le gustaría poder cubrir. Agradece por esta oportunidad de poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Bartolina is a student at university. She is in her last year of studying Pharmacy. She is a very responsible, honest and hard-working person and studies to get ahead. She is married, and her husband is a professor.

Bartolina is very dedicated to her studies and always achieves her goals. It is her dream to finish this career and, in the future, to open a pharmacy in her own house.

She asks for a loan to cover the expenses for her dissertation, as there are many expenses which she would like to cover. She is thankful for this opportunity to continue her efforts.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for her dissertation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kapenta fish to sell.

loans.name: Nobuhle

texts.en:
Nobuhle is a young businesswoman who has a poultry production business. She lives in the Matobo District of Zimbabwe. She produces broiler chickens in batches of 100 birds every six weeks. She also volunteers with Camfed as a Learner Guide who takes students through the My Better World sessions. These sessions focus on teaching students life skills. 

Nobuhle plans to increase the number of broiler birds that she produces to 100 birds every three weeks with the support from a Kiva loan. This would allow her to enjoy higher sales and an increase in profits. With the additional profits, she would like to meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her production of broiler birds

loans.name: Ja'afaru

texts.en: Ja'afaru is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ja'afaru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children. Ja'afaru is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ja'afaru will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ja'afaru can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Ja'afaru is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL TRIUNFO, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño me
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "El Triunfo" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Lamay, province of Calca and department of Cusco.

The member is Victoria. She is 37 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She works in her restaurant business, preparing different plates like chicken with potatoes, soups and beef saltado (a traditional Peruvian dish with peppers and French fries). She works from 10:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has already had this business for seven years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the restaurant business. She is requesting the loan to buy products to cook like chicken, beef and vegetables.

The other partners making a living with businesses in agriculture, selling animals, a grocery store and a food business.

The member thanks those who form part of this dream of hers.

loans.use: to buy products to book like chicken, beef and vegetables

loans.name: Alhaji Danjuma

texts.en: Alhaji Danjuma is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alhaji Danjuma joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: . Alhaji Danjuma is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Alhaji Danjuma will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alhaji Danjuma can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Alhaji Danjuma is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nuhu Danjuma

texts.en: Nuhu Danjuma is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Nuhu Danjuma joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for himself. Nuhu Danjuma is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Nuhu Danjuma will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Nuhu Danjuma can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Nuhu Danjuma is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Emil

texts.es:
Emil está esforzándose por poder cumplir sus metas en la universidad, la de ser un administrador de empresas, está luchando por poder salir adelante y ser una persona útil a la sociedad y a las demás personas que necesiten de su servicio.
Emil comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para seguir con sus estudios. Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene, y seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Emil is striving to fulfill his goal of completing a university education with a major in Business Administration. His ambitions include establishing himself in a career so that earn a decent living, becoming a productive member of society, and helping those in need of his services. 
 
Emil notes that he used the funds from his previous loan to pay university tuition, and that this support was a tremendous help because it allowed him to continue his studies. Emil is applying for a new loan so that he can pay the costs associated with receiving and accrediting his university degree. Once he has established his credentials as a university graduate, he can move on to start his career.

loans.use: to pay the costs associated with accrediting his university degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cooking materials such as fish, pig feet, bag of rice, oil, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock in her store

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en: Clemencia is a 27-year-old mother of one from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. For the past four months, she has been selling kapenta (dried sardines) in addition to her volunteer Camfed Learner Guide position. As a Learner Guide, she teaches life skills education at local schools. With the Kiva loan, Clemencia intends to make bulk purchases of dry kapenta, that way she can meet the demand of her customers. Increased sales and profits will be beneficial in supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase more kapenta to sell

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Librada está en el  ciclo número 6 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de ella podrán conocer la situación de cada una y poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de forma particular, tiene su clientela formada en la zona ya que hace tiempo se dedica a esta actividad. Gracias a dicha actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Según su última encuesta ya se encuentra mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
La Sra. Delia solicita este préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir de temporada para poder abastecer a su clientela.
texts.en:
The Santa Librada group is in the sixth cycle of the Women's Committee Program. This program brings women together so they can support each other in their efforts to earn a living and provide for their families. The group members are participating in the poverty elimination survey, which identifies each member's unique situation and the factors they need to address in order to succeed. 

Señora Delia is one member of Santa Librada, and runs a business selling clothes. She has an established customer base in the area as she's been running the business for some time now. Selling clothes allows Señora Delia to support her household and boost her income. The results of her last poverty elimination survey showed that she is making progress and improving her family's living conditions. 

Señora Delia is applying for a loan for the purchase of seasonal clothing so that she can meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Mainumby Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mainumby  está en el ciclo 10  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ellas podrán conocer la situación de cada una de ellas y conforme a ello poder seguir trabajando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorena, ella  es limpiadora en una empresa de construcción y también se dedica a la venta de desayunos a los obreros de la misma empresa, en su última encuesta se encontraba mejorando su situación de pobreza, con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.  También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder preparar los desayunos que vende, como ser leche, café, panificados, azúcar, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group Mainumby is in its 10th cycle of the women's committee program, which analyzes the financial situation of each member and looks to eliminate poverty. One of its members is Lorena, who works as a cleaning lady in a construction company and also sells breakfasts to its workers. According to her last survey, she has improved her financial situation with hard work and sacrifice. The work that the advisers do stands out, as they do a permanent follow-up of training and verifications. 

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for the breakfasts she sells, such as milk, coffee, bread products, sugar, etc. Her goal is to keep selling and to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, bread products and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a 50-year-old farmer from Gidan Gambo.  As a Babban Gona member, Mathew, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Mathew can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Mathew is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  80 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Mathew is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Ephraim,  and  Bilya. Mathew’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Auwal

texts.en: Auwal is a Babban Gona farmer from Auta Makeri. Auwal expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Auwal to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Auwal can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Auwal, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 30 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Auwal will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Auwal will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Supriya

texts.en:
Sabuj Sangha NGO is working for sustainable development of marginalized and vulnerable people. It aims to improve quality of life through empowerment, education, information, infrastructure development, healthcare provision and economic self-reliance. It achieves this through the convergence of services provided by local self-governments. 

Supriya is a member of Atithi Self-Help Group supported by Sabuj Sangha. She lives in Madhumsadhan-chack village, West Bengal, with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. 

Supriya’s son has been working in an electrical goods shop for the last three years, and now he wants to start his own shop with the help of his mother. So Supriya is seeking a loan of INR 3,000. She will use the loan amount to set up their own shop, which will help them to generate more income.
 
They hope to earn more from the shop and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to start an electrical goods shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell so that her sales and profit margins increase.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is a 23-year-old mother of one from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She operates her own grocery store and volunteers as a community health activist who disseminates health information to schools and as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills to young students. 

With the Kiva loan, Cathy would like to purchase more groceries to sell to increase sales and profits. With the increased sales, she also intends to expand her business, create employment opportunities in her community, and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Librada está en el ciclo número 1 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que está con muchas expectativas de mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de ellas integrantes es la Sra. Mabel quien es funcionaria y además tiene un proyecto de huerta y cría de lechones.
Gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Según su encuesta se encuentra mejorando bastante, y podrá seguir haciéndolo por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
La Sra. Mabel solicita este préstamo para preparar su huerta y comprar los lechones para la cría.
texts.en:
The Santa Librada Group is in the first cycle of the Women's Committee Program and each member is participating in the poverty elimination survey. The group members have great hopes that they'll be able to improve their living conditions.

One member of Santa Librada is Señora Mabel, a civil servant who also grows vegetables and raises pigs. Managing a garden and livestock in addition to her job have allowed Señora Mabel to maintain her household and boost her income so that she can support her family. The results of the poverty elimination survey show that she is making notable progress and that her business is sustainable thanks to her diligent efforts and sacrifice.  

Señora Mabel is applying for a loan so that she can prepare her vegetable garden and purchase pigs to raise.

loans.use: to prepare a vegetable garden and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
Santa Clara se llama este grupo, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde las 23 señoras podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Mirna se dedica al comercio, es decir tiene un local de venta de artículos de bazar y regaleria. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Según su encuesta se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, luchando por poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Mirna solicita este préstamo para la compra de artículos de bazar variados para surtir su local, ya que tiene mucha clientela a quien quiere seguir satisfaciendo con la variedad de sus productos.
texts.en:
This group is called Santa Clara and carries out an analysis for the elimination of poverty. Its 23 members are able to know the financial situation of each of them. 

Mirna has a store where she sells bazaar items and gifts. Thanks to her job, she can cover household expenses and increase her income. According to the survey, she has improved her financial situation by fighting to support her family and loved ones. She is requesting this loan to buy bazaar products for her store, so that her clients will remain satisfied with the range of products offered.

loans.use: to buy a range of bazaar products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando por poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virna quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, y  por medio de las ventas que hace en su despensa está creciendo y saliendo adelante.
La Sra. Virna solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para surtir más su local y abastecer a su clientela con: panificados, verduras, leche, carne, embutidos, enlatados y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa is carrying out an analysis for the elimination of poverty. Its members are women head of their families, who fight to provide their loved ones with everything they could not have. 

One of its members is Virna. In her last survey she showed a level 3 of poverty, which means that she has improved and got ahead thanks to her hard and continuous work in her store. Virma is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her store so that she can offer a variety of products to her clients, such as breads, vegetables, milk, meat, cold meat and cans, among others. She is grateful for this opportunity that will allow her to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy bread products, vegetables, milk, meat, cold meat and cans, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more frozen food (fish, pork, chicken, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Shafiu Ibrahim

texts.en: Shafiu is a 50-year-old farmer from Danlawal.  As a Babban Gona member, Shafiu , is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Shafiu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Shafiu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  120 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Shafiu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children Basiru and Inusa. Shafiu’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Riqui Darwin

texts.es:
Riqui tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de un bien. La compra realizara en Ventanas. Su meta es comprarse una casa. Su desafío es que le ocurra algun accidente en el trabajo. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Riqui is a single 22-year old man who lives with his parents and his 2-year old son. They live in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos. 

He works in agriculture sowing corn and is requesting the loan to buy supplies in Ventanas. His goal is to buy his own house and his challenge is to overcome potential accidents in his job. He likes to do sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more seeds, fertilizers, and chemicals so that she could expand her production.

loans.name: Nancy Soledad

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus hijos de 10, 8, 1 año en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. Las compras realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es comprarse un vehículo. Su desafío es la  influencia del clima y plagas en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a ver novelas.
texts.en:
Nancy is a single 28-year old woman who lives with her children, ages 10, 8 and 1, in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos. 

She works in agriculture sowing corn and is requesting the loan to buy supplies in Ventanas, such as fertilizer, insecticide, urea and fungicide. Her goal is to buy a car and her challenge is the influence of the weather and plagues in her plantations. She likes to watch soap operas in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Las Palmeras De Cocabambilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS DE COCABAMBILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es conviviente y tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida. 



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Las Palmeras de Cocabambilla".  This bank is located in the Quillabamba district, in the province of La Convencion and department of Cusco.

One member is Señora Teresa; she is married, 39 years old, and has two children.  Teresa works in her grocery business.  She sells basic items like rice, sugar, milk, and oil, and works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.  She has already spent one year in this business and it is going well.  Her dream is to expand her grocery business.  Teresa is asking for a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The other members make a living in various businesses that sell coffee, fruit, groceries, and food.

Teresa is grateful to those who form a part of this dream through these means, and she promises to complete her repayments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta 5º grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y han formado sus propios hogares.

José se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño, y lo hacía en compañía de su padre y hermanos, hoy en día se cultiva 3 hectáreas maíz y uno de sus hijos le ayuda en el trabajo que realiza.

Él necesita muchísimo este crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos y para invertir en la preparación de la tierra donde va a sembrar.

Sus metas a futuro son seguir trabajando para mantenerse por su propia cuenta, y siempre tener ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
José is a 64-year old man who studied up to 5th grade. He lives with his partner, who is a housewife, and has 5 children, who are adults and have their own families. 

José has worked in agriculture since he was a little boy and learned from his father and brothers. He currently sows 3 hectares of corn and one of his sons helps him. 

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers, and to invest in the land where he will sow. His goal in the future is to be able to keep working for himself and to cover his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizers, and to invest in the land where he will sow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a carton of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule is a Babban Gona farmer from Danlawal. Sule expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Sule to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sule can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sule, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Sule  will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Sule will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Sani Sambo

texts.en: Sani Sambo is a 30-year-old farmer from Danlawal.  As a Babban Gona member, Sani Sambo, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sani Sambo can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Sani Sambo is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of a total of 90 bags of maize on his 0.8 ha field this season.  Sani Sambo is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children Yusuf, and  Salamatu. Sani Sambo’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children Yusuf, Salamatu, and Hauwa are educated and have professional jobs” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Atyrgul

texts.ru: Атыргул 45 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. Старшему сыну 25 лет, младшему 13 лет. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Атыргул высшее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, Атыргул занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес в 2001 году с 12,000 сом (KGS). Хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент в хозяйстве Атыргул имеется 2 коровы, 2 телят и 10 овец. Также на 0,90 ГА поливной и 0,90 ГА богарной земли, где Атыргул выращивает картофель, чеснок, кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атыргул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Атыргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Atyrgul is 45 years old, married and is a mother to two children.  Her oldest son is 25 years old and her youngest is 13 years old. Her spouse and children are all helping with the household.  Atyrgul has a university education and for the main source of income to the family, Atyrgul is raising livestock and growing crops.  She started this business in 2001 with an initial investment of 12,000 som (KGS).  Her current monthly income is approximately 8,000 som (KGS).  Today, Atyrgul has two cows, two calves and 10 sheep.  Also, on a 0.9 hectares of land, she is growing potatoes, garlic and corn.  In order to expand her business, Atyrgul turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional calves for fattening and resale.  Profits from her business, Atyrgul is planning to invest into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase calves for further fattening and resale in order to invest in growth of business

loans.name: Burmabu

texts.ru: Бурмабу 56 лет, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. Бурмабу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2002 года начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с покупки 7 овец, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Бурмабу имеет в хозяйстве 4 коровы, 50 овец. На земельном участке выращивает картофель, клевер и кукурузу, вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Бурмабу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят с целью откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бурмабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Burmabu is 56 years old, married and has raised two children.  The main source of income to Burmabu's family is her business of raising livestock and growing crops, which she started in 2002.  She launched her business by purchasing seven sheep.  Thanks to Burmabu's hard work, today she has 4 cows and 50 sheep.  On her plot of land, she is growing potatoes, clover and corn.  Her hard work brings-in approximately 7,000 som (KGS) each month.  In order to expand her business, Burmabu turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional calves for fattening and resale.  Profits from her business, Burmabu is planning to invest into further growth of her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy calves for fattening and resale in order to generate more profits and to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods, such as coal, cold water, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta 4º grado, actualmente está acompañado y trabaja vendiendo verduras de casa en casa, con su pareja ha procreado dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando y viven y dependen de Carlos.


Carlos realiza la venta de verduras en bicicleta, actividad que ha venido desempeñando desde hace mucho tiempo y lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, además de la 1 de la tarde en adelante trabaja embolsando pan en una panadería y lo hace de lunes a viernes.

 
El crédito lo necesita para cancelar una deuda que tiene en otra institución y además cubrir otra necesidad de comprar mas pan y  darle trabajo a otra persona para que vaya a otros pueblos a vender este producto, de esa forma cubrirá la necesidad de obtener mas ingresos y el préstamo le ayudará para poder seguir adelante.

El sueño de Carlos es tener varios empleados que distribuyan el pan y  con el tiempo poner una panadería pequeña.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old with a fourth-grade education, married, and the father of two school-age children who rely on him for support. Carlos has sold vegetables door to door, traveling by bicycle, for several years. He also works in a bakery on weekdays, bagging bread from 1 p.m. into the evening. Carlos learned to sell produce and started working in the bakery because he had to support his family.   

Carlos is applying for a loan to off a different loan that he received from another lender; he will also purchase additional bread and hire another person to sell bread in other towns. This loan will thus allow him to earn higher income and help him improve his situation and his family's.  

Carlos's ambition is to have a small staff to deliver bread and set up a small bakery.

loans.use: to off a loan he received from another lender and to purchase additional bread and hire another person so he can sell his goods in other towns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en El Alto con sus padres en una casa de ladrillo y cemento. Ramiro se dedica al transporte publico Ramiro pide un prestamo para hacer mantenimiento de movilidad Ramiro es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Ramiro is a single man with no children.  He lives in El Alto with his parents in a brick and cement house. Ramiro earns a living in public transport. He is asking for a loan for the maintenance of his vehicle. Ramiro is the only source of income in his home and, for this reason, needs assistance.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet es soltera pero tiene un hijo ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe y se gana la vida como cuidadora de un terreno y como artesana Lizet necesita un credito para  comprar lana que le sirva para su actividad Ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Lizet is single but she has a child. She lives in El Alto in an adobe house and is employed as a caretaker of a piece of property.  As an artisan, Lizet needs a loan to buy wool that she can use in her artisanal activity. She is the only source of income in her household and, for that reason, she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy wool that she can use in her artisanal activity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (chicken, palm oil, ago oil, peppers, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pellagia

texts.en: Pellagia is an 18-year-old married young woman who lives in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools assisting community health trainers in disseminating health information to students. She also operates a store where she sells products such as clothes, bags, and shoes, as well as grocery items. She started her business in 2013 to support her three siblings. She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand it. The loan will allow her to purchase more groceries, jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her education and continue supporting her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio vive en la casa de sus Padres en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto. Marco Antonio  trabaja como ayudante de un taller mecánico, por las noches estudia mecánica automotriz  en un instituto de la ciudad de el alto.
Marco Antonio necesita el crédito para cancelar una capacitación que esta cursando.

El sueño de Marco Antonio es ejercer una profesión y tener un taller mecánico propio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marco Antonio lives in his parents house in the Villa Cooperativa area of the city of El Alto. Marco Antonio works as an assistant in a garage and at night studies automobile mechanics at an institute in the city of El Alto. Marco Antonio needs a loan  to pay for the training he is taking. Marco Antonio's dream is to work in his profession and have his own repair shop and thus improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to pay for training he is taking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 7º grado, por la situación económica no pudo seguir estudiando, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz, tiene 2 hijos y solo uno estudia en la escuela.

Yanira se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante, ella atiende un chalet en la escuela de la comunidad desde hace 3 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar con su madre vendiendo pupusas y antojitos, todos los días tiene que madrugar para llegar temprano a la escuela a atender el chalet. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería y surtir el chalet, de esta forma podrá satisfacer la demanda de los estudiantes y obtendrá más ingresos en el negocio.

Yanira espera para un futuro darles el estudio a sus hijos si es posible hasta la universidad, y seguir adelante con el negocio para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Yanira is 31 years old and married to a farmer who grows corn. The couple has two children, one of whom is in school. Yanira has only a seventh-grade education as her family could not afford to send her to school beyond that level. 

Yanira has for a long time been a small businesswoman. She has worked in a mini-store in her community's school for the past three years. Before starting that business, Yanira and her mother sold pupusas [tortillas filled with cheese, meat, and beans] and traditional corn-based dishes. Yanira goes to work early each morning to work in the school mini-market. 

Yanira requires a loan to purchase merchandise to stock the mini-market so she can meet demand from students and boost the business' income. 

Yanira hopes to help her children attend university, so she's striving to make her business succeed and support her family.

loans.use: para comprar mercadería y surtir el chalet, de esta forma podrá satisfacer la demanda de los estudiantes y obtendrá más ingresos en el negocio.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus hermanos en La paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Alcides es taxista y esta sometido a muchas horas de trabajo  y corre el riesgo de tener un accidente porque su vehiculo no esta en buenas condiciones por lo que necesita un credito para hacer arreglos a su vehiculo Alcides es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Alcides is single, has no children and lives with his siblings in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to his family. Alcides is a taxi driver and works many hours and runs the risk of getting into an accident as his car is not in good condition. So he needs a loan to repair his vehicle. Alcides is the only source of income in his household so he needs your help.

loans.use: to fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock in her store because she has growing demand for school supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
En Suchitepequez existe una variedad de negocios donde la gente puede escoger donde consumir sus necesidades diarias.  Pero lo importante no es la cantidad de consumo sino la calidad de esos servicios al cliente.

Cristina mujer de 31 años se ha dedicado, con su tienda de abarroterías, servir al público con una calidad de servicio.  Se necesita una vocación especial para ello y Cristina lo tiene porque es una de las negociantes más buscadas en su negocio.

Dos razones le han motivado para solicitar  un préstamo: ampliar su negocio de abarrotería por la cantidad de clientes que le buscan y la necesidad que tiene de construir una casa para sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
In Suchitepequez there are a number of businesses where people can find their daily necessities. What is important is not quantity of goods offered but the quality of service provided to the client.

Cristina is a 31 year old woman who has with her grocery store dedicated herself to provide quality service to the public. You need a special calling for this and Cristina has it as she has one of the most popular businesses in this market. She has two reasons for requesting a loan: to expand her grocery business because of the number of people that use it and to build a house for her two children.



Dos razones le han motivado para solicitar un préstamo: ampliar su negocio de abarrotería por la cantidad de clientes que le buscan y la necesidad que tiene de construir una casa para sus dos hijos.

loans.use: to invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a 30-year-old farmer from Kunkumi. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isiyaku can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Isiyaku is ambitious and is aiming to reap 100 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Isiyaku said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Jona, Timothy,  and Jamima, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un joven que está estudiando y trabajando a la vez para poder salir adelante, quiere progresar y crecer no solo como profesional, sino también como persona.
Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, con lo que quiere poder ayudar a los demás. Hoy pide este préstamo para poder comprar una computadora, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda, y le servirá como material de apoyo en sus trabajos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Martín is a young man who's going to school and working at the same time so he can get ahead.  He wants to make progress and grow, not only professionally but also as a person.  He's studying business administration because he wants to be able to help others.

He's requesting this loan so he can buy a computer.  It will be a big help to him with his work in the university.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Ureyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Es la hora de almuerzo, los trabajadores de la fábrica de tabaco salen de sus oficinas para probar el plato del día de Ureyda, una de las mejores cocineras cerca del trabajo. El lugar es humilde, pero el sabor de la comida hace que esta madre soltera de dos niños de 12 y 6 años, sea tan amada por todos los que llegan por ahí. Con cinco años en su negocio y con sus estudios universitarios, hacen de esta mujer de 36 años toda una microempresaria orgullosa, quien inculca a sus hijos la educación, pues considera que solo de esa forma se puede salir adelante en la vida. Ureyda inició con algunos créditos de unas financieras y un capital propio de su primer negocio de pulpería, el cual dejó debido que la venta de comida generaba mayores ingresos. Poco a poco fue invirtiendo hasta llegar hasta donde está.  
Sus hijos son los únicos que la apoyan moralmente. No tiene otros ingresos, pero siempre sigue con su visión de seguir creciendo, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para comprar pollo, carne, arroz, frijoles, verduras, entre otros productos para ofrecer una comida de calidad. En estos momentos se siente cómoda en el lugar donde está ubicada, pues es muy bien reconocida, pero desearía llegar a tener en un futuro distintos locales alrededor de la cuidad. Entre sus metas está comprar una vitrina para vender sopas instantáneas, chicles y golosinas. Más adelante, desea invertir en su casa, ya que se sabe que se lo merece por ser una mujer trabajadora, solidaria, soñadora y luchadora para que sus sueños se cumplan.
texts.en:
It is lunchtime and the workers from the tobacco factory come out of their offices to try the daily special from Ureyda, one of the best cooks close to their work. Her place is humble but the flavor of food that this single mother of two children aged 6 and 12 makes her loved by all that come here.

With five years in business and her university studies this 36 year old woman is a proud micro-entrepreneur. She is instilling the importance of education to her children as she considers it the only way to get ahead in life. Ureyda started out with a few loans from financial institutions and her own capital to open her first business a small store which she left as the sale of meals generates more money. Little by little she has been investing to arrive at where she is today. Her children are her only moral support. She has no other income but always has the vision of continuing to grow.

So she is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, meat, rice, beans, vegetables amongst other products to offer a quality product. At this time she feels comfortable with where she is located as she is well-known. But in the future she would like to own cafes all around the city. Amongst her goals is to buy a display window to sell instant soups, Chiclets and sweets. Later on she wants to invest in her own house as she knows she deserves it for being a hard-working, supportive woman, who is a dreamer and a fighter who wants to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, beans, vegetables, amongst other products.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 50-year-old farmer from Kunkumi. As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel is ambitious and is aiming to reap a total of 150 bags this season on his 1.40 ha field. When asked, Emmanuel said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children ILiya, Sulemanu,  and  Hajara, and I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, luego se dedicó a trabajar con su madre, ahora está casada y tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura.

Desde muy pequeña, María se ha dedicado a trabajar en la venta de antojitos ya que su madre también realizaba esta misma actividad, esta actividad la realiza todos los días y se ubica a la orilla de la calle donde transita mucha gente, todos los preparativos para la venta los hace durante la mañana y sale a vender en las tardes.

María necesita muchísimo de este crédito para comprar más insumos necesarios para la preparación de los antojitos, además quiere comprar una cocina para preparar pupusas.

Ella espera para un futuro construir un pequeño chalet donde pueda poner su negocio y no tenga que andar trasladándose de un lugar a otro.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old, attended school until the 8th grade, and then worked with her mother.  She is now married, and has 2 children who are studying at the community school; her husband works in agriculture.

From a young age, María has worked in the sale of appetizers, since her mother also performed this same work.  She does this work every day and is situated on the sidewalk where there are many passerby.  She does all of the preparation for her sales in the morning and leaves to sell them in the afternoon.

María needs this loan very much in order to purchase more of the necessary ingredients for making appetizers, and would also like to purchase a stove to prepare pupusas (a stuffed corn-tortilla dish).

In the future, she is hoping to build a small snack bar where she could set up her business and not have to walk around from one place to another.

loans.use: to purchase more necessary ingredients for making appetizer dishes.  She would also like to purchase a stove to make pupusas (a stuffed corn-tortilla dish).

loans.name: Karen Perfecta

texts.es: Karen tiene una edad de 34 años, tiene un grado de educación de secundaria incompleta la cual curso solamente su primer años de ciclo común básico. Ella es casada y su compañero de hogar se dedica a la construcción con el cual procrearon 2 hijos los cuales viven en casa. El menor estudia en la escuela y la mayor ya está en el colegio finalizando su carrera. Su fuente de ingreso es la siembra y cultivo de arroz actividad que trabaja desde hace 2 años la cual aprendido gracias a la ayuda de su esposo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la siembra y cultivo de café. El terreno que ella trabaja es alquilado siendo sus clientes los diferentes intermediarios que habitan en la zona. La distancia desde su casa de habitacion a la zona donde trabaja es de 15 kilómetros lo cual hace en ocasiones en vehículo y la mayoría de veces en bicicleta. Por lo que ella está solicitando apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas abono, urea, foliar, mecanización del terreno y pago de mano de obra mejorando de esta forma la producción de su cultivo. Sus planes como productora de arroz es seguir invirtiendo, ampliando más sus áreas de cultivo obtener mayores ingresos y volumen de cosecha de esta manera ella mejorar el bienestar de sus hijos tratando de invertir parte de las ganancias en la compra de un pequeño terreno donde ella pueda empezar a trabajar de forma propia.
texts.en:
Karen is 34 years old and married to a construction worker with whom she has two children. Both children live at home, the younger one in primary school and the older one about to graduate from high school.
