Karen herself completed only the equivalent of junior high and did not continue on to the high school level.  

Karen has for the past two years earned a living planting and harvesting rice. She previously grew coffee, but her husband helped her learn to grow rice. Karen rents a plot of land that is 15 kilometers from her home, so she usually goes to work on a bicycle, but sometimes rides in a car. She sells her crop to brokers in the area. 

Karen is applying for a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as manure, urea, foliar fertilizers [which plants absorb through leaves], machiner to work the land, and to pay laborers. These investments will help Karen boost her rice yield. She plans to keep investing, expanding her land, increasing her harvest and earning more income so she can provide for her children. Karen also will invest part of her earnings in the purchase of a small plot of land that she can work herself.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay laborers to help with her rice crop.

loans.name: Lelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lelis de 21 años de edad, está soltera, vive junto a su madre y sus tres hermanos, es la mayor de sus hermanos y es la que apoya a su madre todos los días para salir adelante, estudió hasta sexto grado en la comunidad y no pudo continuar debido a las condiciones económicas de la familia.


Lelis se dedica a la venta de antojitos en la comunidad y a la venta de productos de lencería, los cuales vende desde hace ocho años, también apoya a su madre en el manejo de una pequeña tienda que poseen, pues ella sale a vender golosinas y bebidas fuera de una escuela.


Ella solicita este crédito para invertir en productos de lencería para vender en su comunidad.


Su sueño es  ver construida su vivienda de ladrillo para darle seguridad y mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
21-year old Lelis is single and lives with her mother and three siblings. As the eldest she is the one who helps her mother to get ahead on a daily basis. She has a grade six education but couldn't continue because of the cost. 

Leila earns her living selling snacks in the community. She has also sold underwear for the past eight years as well as helping her mother run a small store that they own. She also sells candy and drinks outside a school.

Leila is seeking a loan to buy more underwear to sell in the community. Her dream is to see her family live in a brick house which would give them more security and better living conditions.

loans.use: Buy underwear to sell in the community

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a dedicated farmer and father of three from Kunkumi. As a Babban Gona member, Dauda, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dauda can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Dauda is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Dauda said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Ezikiel, Samson, and Fiddausi,and I want to ensure they are all educated and have professional jobs." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Los Zensontles Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Zenzontle lo conforman tres socias exitosa, emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras, es coordinado por la señora Paula, de 44 años, soltera, se dedica la venta de ropa usada y cosméticos AVON, este negocio lo impulso hace siete años con ayudad de familia, con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda que tiene por parte de su clientela solicita el crédito para invertirlo en cosméticos como vanidad, pinturas labiales, rubor, cremas corporales, crema para cabellos, desodorantes, marbellines, también invertir en la compra de pacas de calidad de pantalones, camisas, chores, camisolas, etc. Con los créditos anteriores brindados la socia ha logrado aumentar la clientela lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse como una microempresaria. Otra de las socias es la señora María Félix de 61 años de edad quien elabora y vende cosa de horno y cajetas en las calles de su comunidad, y la señora Ana de 21 años comerciante de ropa nueva de forma ambulante.
texts.en: The support group Zenzontle is made up of three successful, entrepreneurial and hard-working women. It is led by Paula: she is 44 years old, single, and makes a living selling used clothes and AVON cosmetics. She started this business seven years ago with the help of her family, with a view to meeting her customers' demands. She is asking for a loan to invest in cosmetics such as beauty kits, lipsticks, blushes, body lotions, hair creams, deodorants and other cosmetics. She also wants to invest in quality bulk shipments of trousers, shirts, shorts, sports shirts, etc. With previous loans, she has been able to increase her customer base, which has allowed her to develop as a microentrepreneur. Another member is Maria Félix, aged 61; she makes and sells "cosa de horno" (Nicaraguan sweet tortillas) and "cajetas" (Nicaraguan caramel candies) in the streets of her community. Ana is another member; she is 21 years old, and she sells new clothes as a mobile saleswoman.

loans.use: to buy beauty kits, lipsticks, blushes, body lotions, hair creams, deodorants,  crema para cabellos, desodorantes, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en: Elisha is a 32-year-old farmer from Kunkumi. As a Babban Gona member, Elisha, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Elisha can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Elisha is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Elisha said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children John, Yosi,  and  Dokas, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Tanko

texts.en: Tanko is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunkumi. Tanko expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Tanko to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Tanko can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Tanko, is ambitious and is aiming to reap 65 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Tanko will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.” With this loan, Tanko will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 32-year-old farmer from Kwado.  As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ibrahim can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 50 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Ibrahim is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children Fatima and Aliyu. Ibrahim’s dreams do not end there “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: El Jicarito Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Jicarito es un grupo de mujeres emprendedor y proactivas, es coordinado por la señora Arelys que tiene la edad de 20 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de doy  bebe de seis meses, quien la ha inspirado para su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos y ropas en su comunidad. Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en la mercadería como blusas, camisetas, pantalones, shorts, vestidos, etc., y en cosméticos como pinturas labiales, perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, body corporales, rubor, vanidades, brillos, cremas corporales, desodorantes, etc, de manera que pueda obtener un ingreso y apoyo económico para su familia. Otra de las socias es la señora Rosa que tiene la edad de 41 años, y su negocio es el destace de cerdo en su domicilio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tres cerdos en pies, y la señora Petrona de 44 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para luego venderlos a la comunidad.
texts.en:
The Jicarito group is made up of enterprising and proactive women coordinated by 20-year old Arelys. She lives with her partner, their two children and 6-month old baby. Having a family motivates her to work hard and get ahead. She sells cosmetics and clothing in the community.

Arelys is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, dresses etc. as well as cosmetics such as lipsticks, perfumes for men and women, body lotion, blush, nicknacks, lip gloss, deodorant etc. Then she will be able to earn more money to help her family.

The other women in the group are 41-year old Sra, Rosa who butchers pigs and wishes to buy three more, and 44-year old Sra. Petrona who raises pigs and then sells them in the community.

loans.use: Buy blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, dresses etc.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Los planes de Mayra se centran constantemente en crecer personal y profesionalmente. Afortunadamente, a sus 47 años esta mujer emprendedora se siente totalmente agradecida con el crecimiento que ha logrado con la ayuda de MiCrédito y KIVA. Gracias al préstamo anterior pudo reparar su molino y construyó una pared para poder tener su salón de belleza y su molino en el mismo lugar. 
Ahora tiene dos años con sus negocios y no quiere dejar de crecer. Por esta razón, solicita de un préstamo para darle mantenimiento al molino, afilar el disco, limpiarlo y revisar cualquier pieza que necesite cambio, pues quiere continuar brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes. El mayor sueño de Mayra es mejorar su casa e invertir en su local del molino. Ayúdala a que siga cumpliendo con sus metas.
texts.en: Mayra's plans are constantly focused on growing personally and professionally. Luckily, at the age of 47, this entrepreneurial woman feels totally grateful for the growth she has achieved with the help of MiCrédito and KIVA. Thanks to the previous loan, she was able to reparir her mill and built a wall so that she could have her beauty salon and her mill in the same place. She has been in business for two years now, and she does not want to stop growing. This is why she is asking for a loan for the upkeep of her mill, to sharpen the disk, clean it and check any piece that needs changing, as she wants to keep providing a good service for her customers. Mayra's greatest dream is to improve her house and invest in her business thanks to the mill. Help her to continue achieving her goals.

loans.use: with the upkeep of the mill, to sharpen the disk, clean it and check any piece that needs changing.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a dedicated farmer from Kwado.  As a Babban Gona member, Abdu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abdu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Abdu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  50 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Abdu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to provide for his family. With this loan, he is on his way in achieving his dreams.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a 37-year- old farmer from Bazai. As a Babban Gona member, Ahmed, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ahmed can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Ahmed is ambitious and is aiming to reap 150 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Ahmed said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children Obadiya, Saminu, and Isuhu, and  I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos de 49 años de edad, estudió hasta curto grado, no pudo seguir debido al  conflicto armado que sufrió el país en esa época, su esposa se dedica a la comercialización de tortillas las cuales vende en el pueblo donde reside, es padre de dos hijos de los cuales uno ya no estudia y el otro si estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, de Carlos depende sus hijos y su esposa.


Actualmente, Carlos cultiva una hectárea de maíz y media hectárea de frijoles, hoy en día también trabaja en los cultivos de café en unas fincas que hay en la zona de donde obtiene ingresos económicos para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, para aplicar al cultivo de maíz y frijoles que posee y para preparar la tierra donde realizará la siembra.

Carlos sueña con construir su vivienda de adobe para tener mejores condiciones, espera seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
49-year old Carlos has a grade four education. He couldn't continue at school because of the war in his country at the time. His wife sells tortillas in the town where they live. They have two children, one of whom attends the local school. He supports his wife and their children.

Currently Carlos has a hectare of maize under cultivation and half a hectare of beans. He also works for some of the coffee growers in the area. From these jobs he earns money to provide for his family. He now needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and manure to spread on his maize and beans, and prepare the ground for new plants. 

Carlos's dreams are to build an adobe house so his family can have better living conditions, and to continue helping his children with their studies so they have a good education.

loans.use: .buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and manure to spread on his maize and beans, and prepare the ground for new plants.

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en: Talatu is a 30-year-old farmer from Bazai. As a Babban Gona member, Talatu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Talatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Talatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap a total of 60 bags per on her 0.4ha field. When asked, Talatu said “I plan to  make more money for myself and my family, and ensure my children Obadiya, Alsa, and Saminu, are educated." With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a 25-year- old farmer from Bazai. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Saratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Saratu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Isuhu, Monday, and Comfort, and make more money for my family.” With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Nilton

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província De Inhambane tem 35 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é  pai de 4 filhos menores de idade todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha na Educação a mais de 10 anos como docente N3, auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas de casa. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção como areia, cimento blocos  para dar continuidade da sua obra de residência. Este é seu 4º empréstimo na hluvuku. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra e fazer um muro de vedação. O seu maior desafio é concluir o ensino superior e adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Nilton comes from Massinga, province of Inhambane. He's 35 years old and married. He has four underage children and all of them are in school. He's not responsible for anyone else.
He has worked in education for over ten years. He's a teacher and earns an income with which he pays for his household expenses. With this loan he intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement and bricks so he can continue building his house. This is his 4th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to finish the construction work and build a fence wall. His biggest challenge is finishing college and buying a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement and bricks, so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Osoria

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 31 anos de idade é viúva, mãe de 3 filhos que se encontram a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua irmã que vive com seu avo.
Trabalha no Governo a mais de 6 anos como escriturária, auferindo mensalmente um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa, pretende com este empréstimo adquirir material de construção como blocos, cimento, varões e areia para finalizar a sua obra. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e mobiliar a mesma, tem como desafio garantir os estudos dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Osoria comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. She's 31 years old and a widow. She has three children who are in school. She supports her sister, who lives with their grandfather.
She has worked for the government for over six years. She's a clerk and earns a monthly income with which she pays for household expenses. With this loan she intends to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement, rods and sand so she can finish building her house. This is her second loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to finish building her house and furnish it. Her challenge is providing her children with an education all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement, rods and sand so she can finish builsing her house.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a dedicated father and farmer from Danju.  As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Iliya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Iliya is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in a yield of at least 100 bags this season.  Iliya is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children Rabiu,  and  Habi. Iliya’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Adelino

texts.pt: O Senhor Adelino é casado e vive com a esposa e quatro filhos. O Ele é avicultor e motorista. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir pintos, racções. Tem  sonho de aumentar a capacidade de criação de frangos para o abate e adquirir poedeiras para a produção de ovos para comércio.
texts.en: Adelino is married and lives with his wife and four children. He's a poultry farmer and a driver. With the current loan he intends to purchase chicks and feed. His dream is to expand his broiler chicken farm and buy laying hens in order to produce eggs for selling.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Amélia

texts.pt:
A Senhora Amelia  é viuva a dois meses e tem 2 filhos que estudam, vive na casa propria com os filhos. Ele é caixa de uma mercearia e faz negócio por conta própria (venda de produtos alimentares por ecomendas). Com o presente empréstimo ela vai adiquirir produtos alimentares  que são arroz, aҫúcar, peixe carapau, feijão, leite, polony, carne de porco e danone  para revender. Com estes produtos  vai aumentar o volume do negócio. Tem dificuldades no transporte das mercadorias do local da compra ate aos clientes.
O seu maior sonho é ver  os seus filhos formados.
texts.en:
Amelia was widowed two months ago and she has two children who study. She lives with her children in a house that she owns. She's a cashier at a grocery store and also does business on her own (selling foodstuffs on request). With the current loan she'll purchase foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, horse mackerel, beans, milk, bologna, pork and yogurt for re-selling. With these products she'll increase her turnover. She faces difficulties in transporting the merchandise from the place of purchase to her customers.
Her biggest dream is to see her children graduate.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, horse mackerel, beans, milk, bologna, pork and yogurt for re-selling.

loans.name: Blanca Nely

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y ha procreado una hija que ya estudia parvularia, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos, maíz y frijoles) y también trabaja en la albañilería.

Blanca trabaja todos los días tejiendo hamacas de seda y de poliseda, arte que le enseñó su hermano menor cuando el aprendió en un taller que impartió una institución, además se dedica a la sastrería desde hace varios años y lo aprendió de su hermana mayor, decidió aprender por la necesidad que tenía de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, además Blanca se ha dedicado a la crianza de especies menores, como aves de corral y cerdos que engorda para luego ir a venderlos en las plazas de la ciudad.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar cinco cerdos, los cuales engordará en un periodo de cinco a seis meses para luego venderlos, también invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz.
Así podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida con la venta de los cerdos y espera obtener mejores cosechas para asegurar la alimentación para la familia.


El sueño de Blanca es ver a su hija ser una profesional ya que la pequeña sueña con ser enfermera cuando sea grande, y Blanca luchará por hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Blanca is 38 years old, is married and has a daughter who is in nursery school. Her husband works in agriculture (growing basic grains, corn and beans) and also works in stone masonry.

Blanca works every day weaving hammocks of silk and poly silk, an art that her younger brother taught her when he learned it in a workshop at an institution. She has also made a living by tailoring for many years and learned this from her older sister. She decided to learn this out of necessity because she had to support her husband with the household expenses. Blanca has made a living by raising smaller animals like poultry and pigs that she fattens to then sell in the plazas of the city.

She is asking for this loan to buy five pigs that she will fatten over a period of five to six months to then sell. She will also invest in buying fertilizers to grow corn. In this way she will be able to improve her living conditions with the sale of the pigs and she hopes to obtain better harvests to ensure her family's food supply.

Blanca's dream is to see her daughter become a professional, as the young girl dreams of being a nurse when she grows up. Blanca will strive to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy five pigs that she will fatten over a period of five to six months to then sell. She will also invest in buying fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
O Senhor Antonio é casado e vive na casa própria com a familia, ele é pai de três filhos menores de idade.  Com emprestimo pretende comprar pintos, ração,  lenha para aumentar o volume da produção de frangos de abate.
O cliente é avicultor a mais de cinco (5) anos por conta propria. Este sonha em adiquirir uma viatura que facilite o tranporte de frangos até ao mercado, visto que reside muito distante do mercado e não tem transportes públicos naquela região. Do momento o Senhor Antonio tem uma bicicleta mais não é facil transportar os frangos na bicicleta principalmente nos dias de  chuva.
texts.en:
Antonio is married and lives with his family in a house that he owns. He has three underage children. With the loan he intends to purchase chicks, feed and firewood so that he can expand his broiler chicken farm.
He has been a self-employed poultry farmer for over five years. He dreams of acquiring a vehicle that makes it easier for him to take the chickens to the market, seeing as he lives very far away from the market and there's no public transportation in that area. At the moment Antonio owns a bicycle but it isn't easy to carry the chickens on a bicycle, especially on rainy days.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and firewood in order to expand his broiler chicken farm.

loans.name: Cremilde

texts.pt: A Senhora Cremilde é solteira e não tem nenhum depedente. A cliente vivia com avó, mais infelizmente esta perdeu a vida e ela passou a viver sozinha. Ela é   trabalhadora e estudante. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar uma geleira. O seu sonho  é terminar a faculdade, casar  e ter filhos.
texts.en: Cremilde is single and doesn't have anyone depending on her. She used to live with her grandmother, but unfortunately she passed away and Cremilde started living alone. She's in the workforce and she also studies. With the current loan she intends to purchase a refrigerator. Her dream is to graduate college, get married and have children.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.pt: A Senhora Gilda é casada e vive com o esposo, um filho, um irmão e um cunhado. Ela é comerciante. Vende roupas usadas para crianças, senhoras e senhores. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir fardos de roupas usadas para revender. Tem como sonho, desenvolver o seu negocio, abrindo mais postos de vendas e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal e mercadorias.
texts.en: Gilda is married and lives with her husband, a son, a brother and a brother-in-law. She's a vendor and sells used clothing for children, women and men. With the current loan she intends to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling. Her dream is to expand her business by opening more sales booths. She also dreams of buying a vehicle for personal and business purposes.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling.

loans.name: Dulce Amistad Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario dulce amistad, está integrado por tres socios proactivos, con capacidades de hacer surgir un negocio, en donde la coordinadora del grupo es la señora Erika de 33 años, acompañada, y se dedica a vender verduras desde hace cinco años en el mercado más populoso de la capital, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de diferentes verduras como zanahorias, quequisques, yuca, plátano, remolacha, etc., y así podrá obtener un avance en el pequeño negocio. La otra socia es la señora Sulma de 25 años de edad, quien ofrece el servicio de venta de comida (fritanga) por las noches. Y el otro socio es el joven Marvin de 20 años de edad, que se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital.
texts.en:
The "Dulce Amistad" solidarity group is formed by three proactive members with the capacity to start a business. The coordinator of the group is Erika, who is 33 years old, is in a relationship, and has made a living by selling vegetables in the most populated market of the capital for the last five years. She is asking for the loan to buy different vegetables like carrots, malanga lila, cassava, plantains, beets, etc., and in this way she will be able to advance her small business. 

The other members are 25-year-old Sulma, who offers the service of selling food (traditional Nicaraguan food) at night, and young, 20-year-old Marvin, who makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the most populated market of the capital.

loans.use: to buy carrots, malanga lila, cassava, plantains, beets, etc.

loans.name: Israelita Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Israelita está conformado por cinco, hombres y mujeres trabajadores y con espíritu emprendedor. El coordinador es el señor Marlon de 37 años de edad, acompañado, quien se dedica a la venta de carne, desde hace un año, puesto que anteriormente trabajaba de guarda de seguridad y de la liquidación tomo la iniciativa de invertir en carne; solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima como carne de posta, lomo, recorte, hueso y costilla alta, etc. La segunda socia es la señora María Luisa de 46 años de edad, que se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y electrodomésticos desde hace cuatro años. La tercera socia es Esmeralda de 40 años de edad, se dedica a vender tortillas y atolillos en las calles de la comunidad. La cuarta socia es la señora Milena de 43 años de edad, vende frutas desde hace nueve años y el quinto socio es el joven de 24 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta d plátanos hace cuatro años en Tipaitapa.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Israelita” consists of five people, men and women, who all work hard and have an entrepreneurial spirit. The coordinator of the group is Marlon, who is 37 years old and in a common law marriage. He started selling meat one year ago. Before that he worked as a security guard and he invested his severance pay into the purchase of meat. He asks for a loan to buy merchandise like round steak, loin, trim, bone and high rib, etc.

The second member of the group is Maria Luisa, 46 years old, who has worked selling clothes and electrical items for four years. The third member is Esmeralda, 40 years old, who sells tortillas and atolillos (custards) in the streets of the neighborhood. The fourth member is Milena, 43 years old, who has sold fruits for nine years, and the fifth member is the youngest one, 24 years old, and he has worked selling bananas in the municipality of Tipitapa for four years.

loans.use: to buy meat like round steak, loin, trim, bone and high rib, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items and used clothes.

loans.name: Harim Adiel

texts.es:
Harim prepara su mochila y plancha su ropa para irse a la universidad. Sin embargo, antes de salir de su casa abre el negocio que hace más de tres años era solo un sueño y que ahora es toda una realidad. Tras vender repuestos en un taller, el cual ahora sirve de proveedor para su negocio, se sintió inspirado en tener su propia pequeña empresa. Con la ayuda económica de su madre y el ahorro que tenía cuando trabajaba para otro lugar lo logró. A sus 21 años, estudia administración de empresas y tiene un taller y venta de repuestos de bicicletas, sin descuidar una actividad de la otra.
Para Harim, los estudios son el arma que lo llevaran a ser una persona exitosa, sin embargo necesita comprar una computadora que le servirá para la universidad y para su trabajo, de manera que cumplirá con dos de sus metas: entregar todas las asignaciones de su universidad que le permitirán graduarse y modernizar su negocio, debido a la facilidad al acceso de la tecnología. Su plan es terminar sus estudios con honores y seguir estableciendo un negocio fuerte.
texts.en:
Harim packs his bag and irons his clothes for university. Before leaving the house, though, he opens the business that three years ago was just a dream. After working selling spare parts at a workshop that now acts as a supplier for his business, Harim was inspired to open his own business. With financial help from his mother and with savings from another job, Harim managed to open the business. At 21 years old, Harim is studying business management and has a business selling spare parts for bicycles. He keeps up both of these activities. 

For Harim, his education is the tool that will help him to be a successful person. However, he needs to buy a computer for his studies and his work. With a computer he will be able to submit all the university assignments he needs for graduation by computer and he can modernise his business with such easy access to technology. Harim's future plan is to finish his studies with honours and to continue developing a strong business.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 21-year-old mother from the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunters as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching leadership skills to secondary school students. 

In addition, Diana earns an income operating a poultry business. Over the past year, she has grown her business to its current capacity which produced about 50 broiler birds every six weeks.  She sells them to the local residents. 

Diana started the business because she wanted to be financially independent. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With the success of her business, she hopes to remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase  broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Laiza

texts.en:
Laiza is a 25-year-old mother, entrepreneur, and volunteer Camfed Learner Guide from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She earns an income selling dried fish and requests a loan from Kiva to purchase bulk quantities of fish to sell to her customers. 

With an increased income, Laiza would increase sales, profits,  financially support her family, and remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.
